of public officers employees and authorized personnel fs   definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning authorized travel means travel as authorized by the city commission or as authorized in an appropriation ordinance city official means an individual who in the performance of his official duties is vested by law with the powers of government and who is elected by the people or appointed by the city commission and has jurisdiction extending throughout the city or any person lawfully serving as either of such classes of individuals as designee or successor common carrier means a train bus commercial airline operating scheduled flights or rental cars of an established rental firm designated authority means the person including the city commission that may authorize travel the city manager shall be the designated authority for his department the city clerk shall be the designated authority for his department the city commission shall be the designated authority for the office of city attorney employee or public employee means an individual other than a city official as defined in this section who is occupying a regular or fulltime authorized position and is responsible to the city manager or the city clerk travel expense means the usual ordinary and incidental expenditure necessarily incurred by a traveler travel period means a period of time between the time of departure and time of return traveler means a city official or employee who is performing authorized travel        11993 cross reference definitions generally  12 rules and regulations the city manager shall promulgate such rules and regulations and prescribe such forms as may be necessary to effectuate the purposes of this division      authority to incur travel expense a all travel by city officials must be authorized by budgetary appropriation or by direct authorization by the city commission additional authorization must be obtained from the appropriate designated authority for all employee travel b travel expenses of travelers shall be limited to those expenses incurred by them in the performance of a public purpose and shall include but not be limited to city business conventions conferences and training or education by which attendance would serve a direct benefit for the city        11993 rates of per diem and subsistence allowance for the purpose of reimbursement and to establish a method of calculation under this division per diem and subsistence allowances may be authorized as follows 1 up to the amounts permitted in subsection 2 of this section for meals plus actual expenses for lodging to be substantiated by receipts therefor 2 authorized travelers may be allowed subsistence while on official business for the city in the amount as listed in the internal revenue service irs publication travel entertainment and gift expenses for the amount of standard meal allowance the standard rates published by the irs shall be used for the following fiscal year 3 when reimbursement according to the terms of subsections 1 and 2 of this section results in outofpocket losses to the personnel involved the designated authority may authorize payment of actual expenses incurred upon such proof as he may deem adequate and provided the expenditure is covered by a budgetary appropriation      2     11993   112205 transportation a under this division all travel shall be upon established direct routes if a traveler elects to take an indirect air route for his convenience costs in excess of the rate for a direct route passage shall be borne by him and he shall be reimbursed only for such direct route fare the designated authority shall determine the most economical method of travel for each trip and in making his determination shall consider the following conditions 1 the nature of the business 2 the most efficient and economical means of travel considering time cost of transportation and per diem or subsistence required 3 the number of persons making the trip and the amount of equipment or material to be transported b the use of a privately owned vehicle for official travel in lieu of public vehicle or common carrier may be authorized by the designated authority if a publicly owned vehicle is not available if traveling by privately owned vehicle the traveler shall receive reimbursement of a mileage allowance per the internal revenue service standard mileage rate as listed in the irs publication travel entertainment and gift expenses the standard rates published by the irs shall be used for the following fiscal year all mileage shall be computed from the point of origin to the point of destination including vicinity mileage necessary for the conduct of official business          11993   112205 other allowable expenses in addition to the travel expenses mentioned in this division the following incidental travel expenses may be reimbursed 1 taxi or limousine fares 2 ferry fares and bridge road and tunnel tolls 3 storage or parking fees 4 communication expenses 5 conference or convention registration fees if attendance at such conference or convention serves a direct public purpose with relation to the person attending such meetings 6 tips        11993 secs 21022130  reserved division 4  city manager and city clerk footnotes  5  charter reference city manager generally  401 et seq cross reference operation of helicopters and hot air balloon authorization by city manager  1829 appointment  residency requirements a the city manager shall be chosen by the city commission solely on the basis of his executive and administrative qualifications with special reference to actual experience or knowledge of accepted practice in respect to the duties of the office set forth in the charter and this section at the time of his appointment he need not reside in close proximity to the city however within such time as shall be set by the city commission the city manager shall reside within a radius of not more than ten miles from the city measured from the location of the city hall b no commissioner shall be appointed city manger during the term for which he shall have been elected or within one year after the expiration of that elected term          10488 charter reference appointment of city manager  402a bond the city manager shall furnish a surety bond to be approved by the city commission such bond to be conditioned on the faithful performance of his duties the premium of the bond shall be paid by the city      removal a the vote for removal of the city manager shall be as provided in charter section 402b removal may be raised and decided by appropriate motion the city commission shall adopt an initial motion for removal designated as a preliminary motion of removal b upon approval of the preliminary motion of removal it shall be transmitted to the city manager and the city manager shall have 15 days from the day of notification of the approval of the preliminary motion of removal to demand a public hearing c upon the city managers request for a public hearing the city commission shall set a date for a public hearing to be held on or before 30 days from the city managers request for such public hearing d the city commission at the public hearing will consider the preliminary motion of removal of the city manager at the close of the public hearing the city commission shall decide whether to adopt a final motion of removal of the city manager the final motion of removal shall require majority vote of all of the commission members e the city manager shall be paid his full salary during the period from the adoption of the preliminary motion of removal adoption of a final motion of removal whether the city manager is suspended from office or not during such period f upon the adoption of a final motion of removal the city manager shall be paid an amount equivalent to two months salary as severance pay this subsection shall not apply where the city managers removal is based upon a violation of any state county or municipal law no severance pay shall be paid unless the city manager has been employed with the city for 12 full months      charter reference removal of city manager  402b commission authority over city clerk a the city commission shall have the sole and exclusive authority to hire to fire and to discipline the city clerk b the city manager shall be entitled to recommend to the city commission that the city clerk be disciplined or fired  but thereafter the commission shall determine if it wishes to follow said recommendation  3398 secs 21352149  reserved division 5  city attorney powers duties and responsibilities of city attorney the city attorney shall have the powers duties and responsibilities to 1 be attorney of record in all civil suits actions and legal proceedings wherein the city city commission city manager departments boards or city officials or employees are parties by virtue of their official positions or official actions except as provided in section 2152 2 institute and prosecute all eminent domain proceedings and other civil suits actions and legal proceedings authorized by the city commission except as provided in section 2152 3 defend all civil suits actions and legal proceedings brought against the city except as provided in section 2152 4 serve as legal advisor to the city commission the city manager and office of the city manager advise personnel as designated by the city manager and city boards who are not authorized to retain separate counsel 5 render written legal opinions requested by the city commission or city manager on matters relating to city government and the interpretation construction and meaning of the charter statutes ordinances resolutions and contracts affecting or pertaining to city government 6 prepare or review and approve as to form and legal sufficiency all city ordinances resolutions deeds contract documents and other legal instruments affecting or pertaining to the city 7 attend and be present at all regular and special meetings of the city commission unless excused from attending by the mayor 8 perform such other duties powers and responsibilities as assigned by the city commission  12198 limitations on city attorneys authority the city attorney shall not compromise settle or adjust any claims debts demands or causes of action in favor of or against the city without prior approval of the city commission nor accept service of process in any suit or action against the city  12198 employment of special counsel the city commission may employ special counsel for specific needs of the city rather than utilizing the services of the city attorney the city attorney shall not be responsible for the performance of any duties assigned to special counsel  12198 secs 21532179  reserved division 6  law enforcement definitions a law enforcement activity means any person who is appointed or employed by the city of st pete beach  who is vested with the authority to bear arms and make arrests  and whose primary responsibility is the prevention and detection of crime or the enforcement of the penal criminal traffic or highway laws of the state this definition includes all certified supervisory and command personnel whose duties include in whole or part the supervision training guidance and management responsibilities of fulltime law enforcement officers or auxiliary law enforcement officers but does not include support personnel employed by the employing agency b law enforcement activity means the duties carried out by a law enforcement officer  1209831098 secs 21812185  reserved article iii  finance footnotes  6  cross reference taxation ch 78 division 1  generally disposal of surplus city property a the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning personal property includes every species of property except real property with a current value greater than $100000 or any property with a fixed asset tag surplus personal property means personal property which the city commission by resolution has determined to be personal property which is no longer needed by the city and which may be disposed of by sale to the public at large b if the city owns personal property which is in no longer useful to the city or which is burdensome to the city the city commission may adopt a resolution setting forth that the property is no longer useful or is burdensome and authorizing the sale of it to the public at large c the city manager may sell the property only upon such terms and conditions as are approved by the city commission and as are set forth in a duly adopted resolution d all revenue received from the sale of surplus property shall be paid into the general fund except revenue received from the sale of surplus property connected with the sewer system revenue received from the sale of surplus property connected with the sewer system shall be paid into the sewer revenue fund        61411 secs 21872215  reserved division 2  financial planning footnotes  7  cross reference finance and budget review committee  2266 et seq state law reference adoption of the budget fs   initiation purpose and submission of plan a the city manager shall initiate a continuing program of long range financial planning b the plan shall forecast both estimated revenues and proposed expenditures for a minimum of five years c the financial plan shall be submitted to the city commission for periodic review and such other action as deemed appropriate      budgetary control a budgetary control shall be maintained use of encumbrances in the budgetary accounts which reflect budgetary operations and conditions as distinguished from proprietary accounts which show actual financial position and operations to ensure that appropriations are not exceeded b budgeted items for which no liability has been incurred during the current fiscal year may be considered for reappropriation in the next fiscal years budget      budget and appropriations a the tentative annual budget shall be submitted to the city commission as provided in fs   b the appropriation ordinance shall state in clear and precise terms that the budget is adopted by reference and is made a part of the ordinance and that the amounts therein are appropriated for the purposes and for the accounts indicated c the total of appropriations proposed expenditures shall not exceed the total estimated revenues and other funds made available d at any time during the fiscal year the city manager may transfer all or any part of an unexpended appropriation balance from one account to another account or to several accounts within the same fund requests for such transfers will be in writing and will include the justification account number and title for both the original and receiving accounts and will indicate the balance in each account both before and after the transfer each transfer request will be signed by the city manager finance director and department head a transfer between departments must be approved by the city commission          12286   81595 fixed assets a general fixed assets are those fixed assets that have 1 a tangible nature  2 a life longer than one fiscal year  3 a cost greater than $250000  and 4 any categories of property with a lesser value that are determined by the city manager to require inventorying for proper control purposes b fixed assets shall be classified according to the state uniform accounting system c the city manager shall make or cause to be made an annual inventory of the fixed assets of the city the inventory will normally be completed not later than the end of the fiscal year d depreciation will not be recorded as an expense but will be utilized in financial planning for projecting replacement requirements          9589   9799 disbursements a the city commission recognizes and reaffirms the principle that one person should not control all phases of a financial transaction without the intervention of some other person who affords a cross check b no disbursements payments in cash check or other legal tender shall be made except upon approval by the city manager and the finance director      2   secs 22212250  reserved division 3  miscellaneous 11907 secs 22552280  reserved division 4  purchases and contracts purchasing and contracting officer  rules for purchasing procedures a the city manager shall be purchasing and contracting officer for the city and he shall supervise the purchase of all materials goods supplies services and equipment for which funds are appropriated in the budget b the city manager may issue such rules governing purchasing procedures within the administrative organization not inconsistent with the charter and this other ordinances  259            a f   32084   8586   6794 city managers duties  bidding procedures a the city manager shall approve purchases and let contracts necessary for the operation and maintenance of city services including the execution of change orders for city projects for amounts up to and including $2500000 without bids and shall receive sealed bids for purchases or contracts in excess of $2500000 and present the bids to the city commission with his recommendation if the city manager recommends the acceptance of a bid other than the bid with the lowest total price the reason for the recommendation shall be given purchases and contracts which by their nature are impractical to award by competitive bid are exempt from the bidding requirement examples of this type of purchase or contract include but are not limited to the following 1 salaries and wages 2 professional services including but not limited to legal medical services accounting services consultants and insurance policies this subsection is subject to fs ch 287 and any other applicable law 3 any item or service which is available from only one source 4 purchases of supplies such as gasoline and vehicle repair parts which are purchased as needed in quantities costing $2500000 or less at a given time 5 emergency purchases or contracts the delay of which would delay the delivery of city services stop work or threaten life or property the city manager shall notify the city commission of such purchases or contracts at its next meeting 6 purchases made utilization of state contracts or contracts negotiated by other governmental entities or associations affiliated with government b where the city commission determines that it is in the best interest of the city it may authorize the city manager to purchase insurance by negotiation but this shall be done only under conditions most favorable to the public interest and upon a showing that the purchase shall result in the lowest ultimate cost of the coverage obtained c individual items costing $2500000 or less will not be subject to the bid limit even if several items purchased together total more than $2500000 d it is the intent that bidding procedures in this section shall not be circumvented by issuing several purchase orders or checks to cover the purchase of a single item or service  259            b g   32084   8586   6794   62000   61411 waiver of bid requirements upon request of the city manager the city commission may by majority vote waive the bid requirements of this division and authorize the city manager to purchase items or services by negotiation rather than bidding  259            d   32084   8586   6794 budgetary limitations no purchase shall be made contract let or obligation or liability incurred for any item or service which exceeds the current budget appropriation  259            e   32084   8586   6794 emergency purchases if an accident a disaster or another circumstance creating a public emergency occurs the city manager may award contracts and make purchases for the purpose of meeting such emergency but he shall file promptly with the city commission a certificate showing such emergency and the necessity for such action together with an itemized account of all expenditures  259            c   32084   8586   6794 bulk purchases the city commission recognizes that the city does not have central purchasing and warehousing facilities it is the intent however that bulk purchases be made whenever feasible  259            h   32084   8586   6794 secs 22872319  reserved article iv  television origination and transmission facilities operated by the city statement of purpose the city operates television origination and transmission facilities that include a cable television channel and a commercial broadcast channel for the primary purpose of providing information related to the functioning of the city government through these facilities the city presents unedited coverage of city commission meetings and other meetings where activities and issues are discussed and decided that effect the lives of the citizens of st pete beach the city also presents information related to city projects programs and activities that may be of interest to the public these television facilities are operated by the city as an information service for the citizens of st pete beach and the surrounding communities the city commission hereby finds and declares that these television facilities are not public forums the goal of the city in operating these television facilities is to televise only that programming which is in the public interest the city reserves to itself consistent with federal law and federal communications commission regulations the editorial discretion to decide what is in the public interest and therefore what programs should be televised using these facilities  12103 objectives the objectives of the programming for the citys cable casting and broadcasting facilities shall be as follows 1 to provide unedited live coverage of city commission meetings to include repeated taped coverage 2 to provide live andor delayed taped coverage of other public meetings related to the operation of the city government 3 to provide information about city programs projects and activities 4 to provide information regarding the operations and services provided by city departments 5 to cooperate with other governments and government agencies to share information about other government activities that may be of interest to the residents served by the cable and broadcast channels 6 to announce time and place of homeowner and condominium association meetings  12103 access to information facilities access to the citys cable and broadcast facilities shall be limited to city employees city functions and operations except where specifically authorized by this article  12103 program content approval all material and programming aired on the citys cable and broadcast facilities are subject to review and approval in accordance with this article  12103 editing of programming content no city public meeting cablecast or broadcast shall be edited or subjected to editorial comments such meeting coverage shall be from gavel to gavel other public meetings provided to the city for cablecast or broadcast may be edited to fit time slots by prior agreement all noncity public meetings that have been edited must include an announcement indicating that the meeting has been edited departmental programs may be edited under the operational control of the city manager messages shown on the alphanumeric bulletin board may be edited for clarity  12103 promotional announcementsprivately sponsored eventsother government use a promotional announcements for city events and city cosponsored events are acceptable for cablecast and broadcast at the discretion of the city manager b promotional announcements for privately sponsored events charities or outside organizations for which the city has no official sponsorship shall not be allowed  provided announcements of the time and place of homeowner and condominium association meetings shall be allowed and approved by the city manager any questions regarding the appropriateness of any promotional message shall be resolved by the city manager c at the direction of the city commission the use of the citys television facility by other governments or government agencies for the purpose of broadcasting or cablecasting information or educational services of interest or benefit to the citizens of st pete beach and surrounding communities may be allowed provided 1 the jurisdiction presents its request in writing including the material to be broadcast for review and approval by the city manager 2 the requesting jurisdiction agrees to compensate the city for use of the broadcast facility the amount of such compensation shall be determined by the city manager all funds received shall accrue to the general fund 3 the inclusion of the programming does not significantly interfere with the broadcasting of city generated programs  12103 maintaining daily log the city manager shall keep a daily log to record all programming cablecast and broadcast each day by the citys television facility  12103 alcoholic beverages footnotes  1  cross reference businesses ch 26 state law reference alcoholic beverages fs chs 561568 article i  in general definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alcoholic beverage means any beverage containing more than one percent of alcohol by weight club means any group of persons associated together as a duly chartered or incorporated organization including a social club incorporated by order of the circuit court which holds a license issued by the state for the sale of alcoholic beverages establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages means any business or establishment licensed by the state for the sale of alcoholic beverages  any area or part of any property building or structure in which alcoholic beverages are kept for sale offered for sale sold served or dispensed under license by the state  any other area property building or structure or part thereof having an entrance door or other passageway that could in any manner be used or utilized as a means of access ingress or egress into the area in which alcoholic beverages are kept offered for sale sold or dispensed  or which is in any other manner capable of access ingress or egress at any time to the area in which alcoholic beverages are kept offered for sale sold served or dispensed however the term establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages when applied to a hotel or club as defined in this section means that area indoor or outdoor or part of such hotel or club in which alcoholic beverages are kept sold served or dispensed when such area is capable of being closed or in some other manner set apart and forbidden to access including sand beach areas as defined herein and as depicted in the vendors state alcoholic beverage license sale or sell includes any transfer of liquor wine or beer or other alcoholic beverages for a consideration and any gift of liquor beer or wine in connection with or as a part of a transfer of property other than liquor beer or wine or other alcoholic beverages for a consideration sand beach areas means the zone of unconsolidated material that extends landward from the mean high water line to the place where there is marked change in material or physiographic form sovereignty submerged land include but are not limited to tidal lands sandbars shallow banks and lands waterward of the ordinary or mean high water line beneath navigable fresh water or beneath tidallyinfluenced waters vendor means any person who keeps for sale sells or dispenses any alcoholic beverages in any quantity in any place or business licensed by the state for the sale of alcoholic beverages or any person who holds a license from the state for the sale of alcoholic beverages including the owner manufacturer operator proprietor or licensee or the servant agent or employee of any one of such          62515 cross reference definitions generally  12 hours of sale and operation a the prohibited hours for establishments dealing in alcoholic beverages shall be as follows 1 alcoholic beverages in sealed containers for consumption off the premises shall not be sold from  am to  am any day of the week 2 alcoholic beverages for consumption on the premises shall not be sold or served from  am to  am any day of the week      10703   72710   61317 editors note laws of fla ch 631790  3 as amended laws of fla ch 71808  1 provides 76474  1 provides as follows 1 drugstores or prescription shops dealing only in medicines and drugs dispensed for medical purposes shall not be within the prohibitions of this chapter 2 vendors midnight saturday and  am monday 3 all business establishments coming under this act article which are engaged in a business primarily outside the purview of this act article but which maintain a separate department or section within such establishment for the sale of alcoholic beverages shall close only that department or section in conformance with this chapter 4 vendors licensed to sell alcoholic beverages notice fs  56250 certain persons excluded from premises it shall be unlawful for any vendor of alcoholic beverages to allow suffer or permit any intoxicated person or habitual drunkard to enter or remain in any establishment for which such vendor holds a license    6   cross reference alcoholic beverage sales  1341198 consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages a except as provided in subsection d of this section it shall be unlawful to drink or consume alcoholic beverages on or upon 1 all public streets 2 all public beach lands 3 any public sidewalk 4 any city park 5 all private sand beach areas upland of the gulf of mexico and adjacent to private property 6 all sovereignty submerged land b notices  for public beach lands notice of this section shall be posted in a prominent beach access location by the city for upland property is used for some commercial use including but not limited to hotels and resorts on the beach notice shall be posted by the owner and shall contain language determined to be acceptable by the city attorney for upland property used as multifamily residential use the owner or condominium association shall be responsible for posting the notice for upland property is less than three residential living units the city shall post the notice at the closest public access to the beach c containers  it shall be unlawful for any person to carry on or about his person any container of alcoholic beverages whether or not the container is a bottle can carton or other form of container in those areas described in subsection a of this section unless a permit has been issued pursuant to subsection e of this section otherwise allowing said activity to occur under any certain terms and conditions stated in the permit this subsection shall not be applicable in those areas described in subsections a1 and 3 of this section if the alcoholic beverage is contained in a sealed container or if the bottle can carton or other container has never been opened since the time the beverage was originally bottled at the manufacturers or bottlers plant possession of any container of alcoholic beverages wherein the seal has been broken the bottle cap or poptop has been opened or removed or where the container may seem to be open or to have been opened shall constitute prima facie evidence of a violation of this section d permits  permits allowing for the consumption of alcohol for special events outdoor dining or outdoor drinking areas or special occasions may be issued as follows 1 special event permit on public lands  the city commission may authorize the consumption of alcoholic beverages in the areas described in subsections a1 2 3 and 4 in connection with the approval of a special event permit issued pursuant to of of this 2 special event permit on private lands  owners of private sand beach areas may obtain a special event permits for the consumption of alcoholic beverages for special occasions the permits shall be issued by the city manager or designee and shall include conditions necessary to protect the safety health and welfare of the public the upland owner shall be entitled to no more than three permits per month the area of the beach subject to the permit shall be marked with approved temporary markers and the consumption of alcohol shall be confined to the marked area permits shall not authorize consumption before  am and shall terminate no later than  pm 3 conditional use permit on public land  the city commission may authorize the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages in connection with the approval of a conditional use permit for an outdoor dining area or outdoor drinking area in the area described in subsection a1 and a3 as provided by the city of st pete beach land development 4 administrative approval on private lands upon receipt of an accepted site plan application the technical review committee may approve the sale of alcoholic beverages in conjunction with the rental of beach cabanas on private transient lodging property if all of the following requirements are met site plan review and approval process as outlined in division five of the land development code a each transient lodging facility that desires an alcohol cabana service area permit must complete the permitting process and have an active btr business tax receipt for cabana rental associated with the lodging facility b the cabana service area must be delineated by sketch on cop liquor license as well as a component of the site plan review the sketch shall be available for viewing at the transient lodging facility at all times c the cabana service area can be no closer than 75 feet to a property line abutting an existing residential use located outside of the crd community redevelopment district d all occupants of the cabana service area must wear an identifiable and unique wrist band that is exclusive to the upland transient lodging facility the wrist band shall indicate that alcohol must remain in the cabana service area at all times e the cabana service area shall be no closer than 50 feet to the wet sand f the cabana service areas hours of operation shall be  am to  pm g the cabana service areas patrons shall only be served by identifiable transient lodging facility employees in person and all serviceware shall have clearly identifiable transient lodging facility markings h glass and plastic straws are prohibited at all times on the sand beach i only patrons or registered members of the transient lodging facility that have current room rental as well as a cabana rental in the cabana service area may be served alcohol invited guests of the facility patron that desire to be served alcohol shall register with the hotel to secure a wrist band patrons andor guests are prohibited from bringing alcohol into the cabana service area j service of alcohol shall only be provided within a beach cabana service area as delineated by boundary markers consistent with the onsite cop map k penalty violation of the above criteria will result in 1 first violation  written warning to the transient lodging facility 2 second violation  written warning to the transient lodging with the stipulation that the permit will be revoked if additional violation occurs within six months 3 third violation  revocation of the cabana service area permit the transient lodging facility will not be able to reapply for a cabana service area permit for one year for every continual violation an additional six months will be added to this requirement l cabana service area permits shall be issued on an annual basis and subject to all ordinance amendments at the time of renewal   pg            91884   11789   41790   51794   62515   3 82217 editors conduct footnotes  2  state law reference municipal home rule powers act fs ch 166 division 1  generally secs 636665  reserved division 2  nudity footnotes  3  cross reference adult entertainment establishments  1026 et seq  nudity prohibited in certain commercial establishments  26136  alcoholic beverage sales  1341198 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning business includes every kind of commercial establishment occupation calling or operation of institutions where members of the public are served alcoholic beverages 5    c cross reference definitions generally  12 findings the city commission finds there is a concern among city law enforcement officials about an increasing trend toward nudity by owners and employees of businesses serving alcoholic beverages to the public and that such activities and such competitive commercial exploitation of nudity is adverse to the public health peace morals and good order and that it is in the best interest of the public health safety and convenience to restrict such nudity and the commercial promotion and exploitation thereof 5    a purpose the purpose of this division is to proscribe conduct and activities which encourage competitive commercial exploitation of nudity where such conduct and activity is not related to any live act demonstration exhibition performance or entertainment which may be protected by the united states constitution and state constitutional provisions guaranteeing freedom of expression 5    b unlawful conduct  penalties a under this division it shall be unlawful for any person maintaining owning or operating a business to suffer permit require or otherwise direct any person while serving alcoholic beverages to any customer or while seating or directing customers to seats within any business to expose his or her genitals pubic hair pubic hair region or cleavage of the buttocks or any portion of the female breast below the top of the areola where the areola and nipple are not covered by a less than fully opaque covering b it shall be unlawful for any person while serving alcoholic beverages or while seating or directing customers to seats within any business to expose his or her genitals pubic hair pubic hair region or cleavage of the buttocks or any portion of the female breast below the top of the areola where the areola and nipple are not covered by a less than opaque covering c it shall be unlawful for any person maintaining owning or operating a business to suffer permit require or otherwise direct any other person while such person is mingling coming in contact with or likely to come in contact with or in close proximity to customers of the business within areas where alcoholic beverages are served to expose his or her genitals pubic hair pubic hair region or cleavage of the buttocks or any portion of the female breast below the top of the areola where the areola and nipple are not covered by a less than fully opaque covering d it shall be unlawful for any person while mingling coming in contact with or likely to come in contact with or in close proximity to customers of the business within areas where alcoholic beverages are served to expose his or her genitals pubic hair pubic hair region or cleavage of the buttocks or any portion of the female breast below the top of the areola where the areola and nipple are not covered by a less than fully opaque covering e upon conviction of any person of a violation of subsection a of this section the privilege of doing business for the business where the violation took place shall be automatically suspended provided that within 30 days of a conviction ofany person of a violation of subsection a of this section the city commission shall hold a hearing wherein the person shall have an opportunity to appear before the city commission to show cause why the privilege of doing business shall not be suspended for a definite time period or revoked upon completion of the hearing the city commission shall take one of the following actions 1 reinstate the privilege of doing business subject to such conditions as shall be deemed reasonably necessary by the city commission to ensure compliance with this division 2 suspend the privilege of doing business for a period of time to be determined by the city commission not to exceed one year 3 revoke the privilege of doing business of the business f in addition to the penalties for violation of this division the city shall have the right to seek injunctive relief against any person violating this division if the city is successful in obtaining injunctive relief against a violation of this division the party so enjoined shall be required to pay a reasonable attorneys fee to the city to compensate the city for the expense incurred in enjoining the violation 5    dg i j amusements and entertainment footnotes  1  cross reference special events permit requirements  2631 et seq  distribution of handbills restricted  461  noise occupational license tax  7891 et seq division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning adult arcade means a place to which the public is permitted or invited wherein coinoperated or slugoperated or electronically electrically or mechanically controlled still or motion picture machines projectors or other imageproducing devices are maintained to show images including motion pictures films videocassettes slides or other photographic reproductions to five or fewer persons per machine at any one time and where the images so displayed are distinguished or characterized by the depicting or describing of specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas adult bookstore means 1 an establishment having as a substantial or significant portion of its stock in trade books magazines and other periodicals which are distinguished or characterized by their emphasis on matters depicting describing or relating to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas or an establishment with a segment or section devoted to the sale rental or display of such material 2 it is an affirmative defense to an alleged violation of operating an adult bookstore without a permit as provided in this article if the adult material is accessible only by employees and either the gross income from the sale and rental of adult material comprises less than ten percent of the gross income from the sale and rental of goods and services at the establishment or the individual items of adult material offered for sale and rental comprise less than ten percent of the individual items publicly displayed at the establishment as stock in trade in any of the following categories books magazines periodicals or other printed matter  photographs films motion pictures videocassettes slides or other visual representations  or recordings or other audio matter any adult use activity other than the sale or rental of adult material shall preclude the establishments qualifying solely as an adult bookstore and shall mandate its classification as other than an adult bookstore adult booth means a separate enclosure inside an adult use establishment accessible to any person regardless of whether a fee is charged for access the term adult booth includes but is not limited to a peep show booth adult arcade booth or other booth used to view adult material the term adult booth does not include a foyer any person can enter or exit the establishment or a restroom adult bottle club means a bottle club in which any adult use as defined in this section is permitted or occurs or is allowed to occur by the person holding the license or permit for the bottle club or any employee thereof adult dancing establishment means a commercial establishment that permits suffers or allows dancers to display or expose specified anatomical areas additionally any establishment on whose premises an employee who need not be the same employee displays or exposes specified anatomical areas on more than one day in any 30day period shall be deemed an adult dancing establishment and shall be required to obtain a license under this entertainment establishment means adult arcade adult bookstore adult booth adult bottle club adult dancing establishment adult massage establishment adult motel adult motion picture theater special cabaret physical cultural establishment or adult photographic studio as defined in this article including any business establishment whose primary business stock in trade is dependent upon the activities relating to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas as defined in this section or an adult dancing establishment or any other establishment exhibiting or relating to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas any commercial establishment that displays a sign or engages in any other form of advertising capable of leading a reasonable person to believe that the establishment offers presents permits or engages in any form of adult entertainment shall be deemed an adult entertainment establishment under the appropriate classification for the purposes of this the term adult use is synonymous with the term adult entertainment establishment adult massage establishment means a site or premises or portion thereof upon which any person who is an employee manipulates or massages the superficial tissues of the body of another person but does not include the following licensed health care facilities  licensed physicians or nurses engaged in the practice of their professions  educational or athletic facilities if the massage is a normal and usual practice in such facilities  or establishments exempted under fs   adult material means any one or more of the following regardless of whether it is new or used 1 books magazines periodicals or other printed matter paintings drawings other publications or graphic media photographs films motion pictures videocassettes or disks slides or other visual representations recordings or other audio matter which have as their primary or dominant theme matter depicting illustrating describing or relating to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas  or 2 instruments novelties devices or paraphernalia which are designed for use in connection with specified sexual activities adult motel means any motel or hotel boardinghouse roominghouse or other lodging used predominantly for transient customers which includes the term adult in any name it uses or otherwise advertises and actually permits the presentation of film material video or other visual representations which has as its preliminary or dominant theme matters depicting illustrating or relating to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas for observations of patrons thereof adult photographic or modeling studio includes any business establishment which offers or advertises as its primary business stock and trade the use of its premises for the purpose of photographing or exhibiting specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas or the modeling of apparel that exhibits specified anatomical areas adult theater means an enclosed building or an enclosed space within a building or an open air area used for presenting either filmed or live plays dances or other performances either by individuals or groups distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on material depicting describing or relating to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas for observation by patrons therein an establishment which has adult booths or an adult arcade is considered to be an adult theater adult use includes the terms as described under the definition of adult entertainment establishment additionally adult includes any business entity in which there is operated or permitted an adult arcade adult bookstore adult booth adult bottle club adult dancing establishment adult massage establishment adult material adult motel adult photographic or modeling studio adult theater or special cabaret applicant means any person who has applied for an adult use permit bottle club means a commercial establishment operated for a profit whether or not a profit is actually made wherein patrons consume alcoholic beverages which are brought onto the premises and not sold or supplied to the patrons by the establishment whether the patrons bring in and maintain custody of their own alcoholic beverages or surrender custody to the establishment for dispensing on the premises this definition also applies to bona fide restaurants whose primary business is the service of meals and hotel or motel restaurants business entity means any and all persons natural or artificial including any individual firm corporation or association operating or proposing to operate for commercial or pecuniary gain the term operated for commercial or pecuniary gain shall not depend upon actual profit or loss also the term operated for commercial or pecuniary gain shall be presumed where the establishment has an occupational license a business entity includes any enterprise or venture in which a person sells buys exchanges barters deals or represents the dealing in any thing or article of value or renders services for compensation certification of compliancenoncompliance means a notice issued by the department of planning and development indicating to an applicant for an occupational license that the location proposed for an adult use complies or does not comply with the locational requirements of this care facility means any childrens center day nursery nursery school kindergarten or family day care home as defined in laws of fla ch 612681 church means a premises or site which is used primarily or exclusively for religious worship and related activities the term church also includes the terms synagogue temple mosque cathedral church building and any other facility or premises where individuals of a particular religion gather to worship and for any other related religious purposes cleavage when reference is made to the female breast means the midline or furrow between mature female breasts but does not include any portion of the protuberance of the breast when reference is made to the nates such as in the term cleavage of the nates the word means the midline or depression between the nates conviction means a determination of guilt resulting from a plea or trial regardless of whether adjudication was withheld or whether imposition of sentence was suspended department means the department of planning and development and where applicable the city police department spbpd employee means a person who works or performs or provides services in connection with an adult entertainment establishment irrespective or whether the person is paid a salary or wage or is an independent contractor provided such person has a substantial or consistent relationship with the business of or entertainmentservices provided by the adult entertainment establishment the term employee includes but is not limited to performers managers and assistant managers stockpersons tellers and operators where applicable the term employee means a person employed by the city but shall not mean any elected official or the city clerk deputy city clerk or city attorney establishment or commencement of business means and includes any of the following 1 the opening or commencement of any adult use business as a new business 2 the conversion of any existing business whether or not an adult use business 3 the relocation of any adult use business for purposes of determining the date of commencement of business evidence in the form of a certificate of occupancy and an occupational license will be required any decision regarding a given date of commencement may be appealed pursuant to section 10157 law enforcement officer means any person who is elected appointed or employed full time by the state or any political subdivision thereof  who is vested with authority to bear arms and make arrests  and whose primary responsibility is the prevention and detection of crime or the enforcement of the penal criminal traffic or highway laws of the state licensee means any person whose application for an adult entertainment establishment has been granted and who owns possesses operates and controls the establishment mixed use zoning district means any parcel located in the city the municipal or county designation of which allows residential use alone or in any combination with commercial or industrial uses nates means the buttocks  a prominence formed by the muscles running from the back of the hip to the back of the leg opaquely covered means to protect conceal or cover specified anatomical areas with an article of clothing so that the appearance of the specified anatomical areas shall not be apparent to the viewer operator means any person who engages in or performs any activity which is necessary to or which facilitates the operation of an adult entertainment establishment including but not limited to the licensee manger owner doorman bartender disc jockey sales clerk ticket taker movie projectionist employee or supervisor this term is not meant to include repairmen janitorial personal or the like who are only indirectly involved in facilitating the operation of the adult use patron includes any natural person other than an employee operator or licensee or governmental officer while performing duties pursuant to this article or other law person includes individual natural persons partnerships joint adventures societies associations clubs trustees trusts or corporations  and any officers agents employees factors or any kind of personal representatives of any thereof in any capacity acting either for himself or for any other person under either personal appointment or pursuant to law physical culture establishment means any business establishment which offers or advertises massage body rubs or physical contact with specified anatomical areas whether or not licensed business establishments which routinely provide medical services by statelicensed medical practitioners and electrolysis treatment by licensed operators of electrolysis equipment shall be excluded from the definition of physical culture establishments premises means that area in which an adult use is permitted as well as the outside perimeter of a multiuse structure or building in which the adult use is located private performance means the display or exposure of any specified anatomical area by an employee of an adult entertainment establishment to a person other than another employee while the person is in an area not accessible during such display to all other persons in the establishment or while the person is in an area in which the person is totally or partially screened or partitioned during such display from the view of all persons outside the area public recreation area means a tract of land within the city which is kept for ornament and recreation and which is maintained as public property residential zoned property means any parcel located within the limits of the city which allows for residential use school includes a premises or site upon which there is a nursery school kindergarten elementary school junior high school middle school senior high school or exceptional learning center however the term school does not include a premises or site upon which there is an institution devoted solely to vocational or professional education or training or an institution of higher education including but not limited to a community college junior college fouryear college or university special cabaret means any bar dancehall restaurant or other place of business which features dancers gogo dancers exotic dancers strippers male or female impersonators or similar entertainers or waiters or waitresses who engage in specified sexual activities or display specified anatomical areas or any such business establishment the advertising for or a sign identifying which uses the terms adult topless nude bottomless or other words of similar import specified anatomical areas means 1 less than completely and opaquely covered a human genitals or pubic region  b cleavage of the nates of the human buttocks  or c that portion of the human female breast below a point immediately above the top of the areola  this definition shall include the entire lower portion of the human female breast but shall not include any portion of the cleavage of the human female breast exhibited by a dress blouse shirt leotard bathing suit or other wearing apparel provided the areola is not so exposed 2 human male genitals in a discernible turgid state even if completely and opaquely covered specified criminal act means 1 an offense under fs ch 794 sexual battery  2 an offense under fs ch 796 prostitution  3 an offense under fs ch 800 lewdness  indecent exposure  4 an offense under fs ch 826 bigamy  incest  5 an offense under fs ch 847 obscene literature  profanity  or 6 an offense under an analogous statute of a state other than this state or under an analogous ordinance of another county or city specified sexual activities means 1 human genitals in a state of sexual stimulation or arousal for tumescence  2 acts of anilingus bestiality buggery cunnilingus coprophagy coprophilia fellation flagellation masochism masturbation necrophilia pederasty pedophilia sadism sadomasochism sapphism sexual intercourse sodomy urolagnia or zooerasty and any other acts of human masturbation sexual intercourse or sodomy  3 fondling or other erotic touching of human genitals pubic region buttock anus or female breast  or 4 excretory functions as part of or in connection with any of the activities set forth in subsections 1 3 of this definition straddle dance also known as a lap dance or face dance means the use by an employee whether clothed or not of any part of his or her body to massage rub stroke knead caress or fondle the genital or pubic area of a patron while on the premises or the placing of the genital or pubic area of an employee in contact with the face of a patron while on the premises zoning authority means the department of planning and development for the city and where appropriate the appropriate board of authority of the city    111594   22195   52196   111996 cross reference definitions generally  12 authority this article and this both enacted pursuant to fs ch 166 in the interest of the health peace safety and general welfare of the people of the city    111594 legislative findings a the concerns raised in the whereas clauses listed in are incorporated in this article by reference b the concerns raised in the findings incorporated by reference in subsection a of this section raise substantial governmental concerns c adult use establishments have operational characteristics which should be reasonably regulated in order to protect those substantial governmental concerns d a reasonable and simple licensure procedure is an appropriate mechanism to place the burden of that reasonable regulation on the owners and operators of the adult use establishments further such a licensing procedure will place an incentive on the owneroperator to see that the adult use establishment is run in a manner that is consistent with the health safety and welfare of its patrons and employees as well as the citizens of the city it is appropriate to require reasonable assurances that the licensee is the actual owneroperator of the adult use establishment fully in possession and control of the premises and the activities occurring therein e adult use establishments are a pervasively regulated industry making reasonable inspections and administrative searches necessary to enforce regulatory standards in particular the city commission finds 1 removal of doors on adult booths and requiring sufficient lighting in adult theaters advances the substantial governmental interest in curbing the illegal and unsanitary sexual activity occurring at adult theaters 2 the prevention of sexual contact between patrons and employees at adult use establishments is unrelated to the suppression of free expression but serves to address the concerns raised in the findings contained in this section although the dancers erotic message may be slightly less effective from three feet away the ability to engage in the protected expression is not significantly impaired 3 separating dancers from patrons and prohibiting dancers and patrons from engaging in sexual fondling and caressing in adult cabarets would reduce the opportunity for prostitution transactions and thus should deter prostitution 4 the barring of nudity in public places furthers a substantial governmental interest in protecting order and morality this does not deprive one of freedom of expression of whatever erotic message conveyed  it simply makes the message slightly less graphic 5 requiring that the facilities of adult theaters be constructed of materials that are easily cleanable that the facilities be cleaned on a regular basis and that the employees cleaning the facilities take reasonable precautions to avoid contact with possible disease transmitting media is reasonably related to the protection of both employees and patrons from sexually transmitted diseases 6 requiring licensees of adult use establishments to keep information regarding current employees and certain past employees will help reduce the incidence of certain types of criminal behavior by facilitating the identification of potential witnesses or suspects and by preventing minors from working in such establishments 7 the disclosure of certain information by those persons ultimately responsible for the daytoday operation and maintenance of the adult use establishment is substantially related to the significant governmental interest in the operation of such uses in a manner as to prevent the spread of sexually transmitted diseases and to reduce or eliminate the criminal activity associated with adult uses establishments 8 it is desirable in the prevention of the spread of communicable diseases and in the investigation of criminal activity to obtain a limited amount of information regarding certain employees who either engage in the conduct which this article is designed to prevent or are likely to be witnesses to such activity 9 a substantial rational relationship between sexually oriented businesses and sexually related crimes establishes a compelling justification for barring those prone to such crimes from the management of such businesses 10 the fact that an applicant for an adult use license has been convicted of a sexually related crime leads to a rational inference that the applicant is more likely to engage in conduct in contravention of this article 11 the barring of a person from participating in an adult use business shall cease when circumstances are indicated to the city that such persons are no longer criminally inclined 12 barring of such individuals from management of adult uses for a period of years serves as a deterrent to and prevents the conduct which leads to the transmission of sexually transmitted diseases and to the promotion of that criminal activity associated with adult uses 13 because the weight of evidence shows that while adult bookstoresvideo stores which only sell or rent adult material and have no adult booththeater component have similar secondary effects as other adult uses such bookstores do not promote the transmission of sexual diseases an exemption of such limited adult establishments from the licensure requirements but not the locational requirements of this article is appropriate f the city commission desires to simplify the finding of all adult entertainment establishment regulations by combining them into one portion of the is contained in this article this will enable the city to provide a copy of all adult entertainment establishment related legislation by reference to one article of this order to ensure compliance with all requirements for enactment of ordinances relating to rezoning specific parcels of private real property or substantially changing permitted use categories in zoning districts pursuant to fs   the city commission has again reviewed all of the evidence previously presented to it with regard to enactment of  and 9329 and fully and completely incorporates such ordinances fully in this article    111594 purpose the intent of the city commission in adopting this article is to establish reasonable and uniform regulations that will protect the health safety and general welfare of the people of the city the provisions of this article acting alone or together with other applicable ordinances for the city have neither the purpose nor effect of imposing a limitation or restriction on the content of any communicative materials including adult material similarly it is not the intent nor effect of this article to restrict or deny access by adults to adult materials or expression protected by the first amendment or to deny access by distributors and exhibitors of adult uses to their intended market in all matters involving any violation of this article the burden of proof to establish that violation shall be with the city or applicable city department    111594 construction of article this article shall be liberally construed to accomplish its purpose of licensing and regulating adult entertainment and related activities unless otherwise indicated all sections of this article shall apply equally to all persons regardless of sex masculine pronouns such as he his and him as employed in this article shall also be construed to apply to feminine pronouns and neutral pronouns unless the context suggests otherwise    111594 regulation of obscenity subject to state law for the purposes of this article it is not the intent of the city commission to legislate with respect to matters of obscenity these matters are regulated by state law including fs ch 847 as may be amended    111594 regulation of massage establishments subject to state law for the purposes of this article it is not the intent of the city commission to legislate with respect to matters of massage establishments these matters are regulated by state agency the department of business and professional regulation board of massage and by state law fs ch 480    111594 jurisdiction all territory within the legal boundaries of the city shall be embraced by the provisions of this article  25110   111594 applicability of other ordinances and sections of contained in this article is in any way intended to relieve any applicant employee patron person individual partnership corporation or other business entity from complying with any other section of this ordinance of the city with regard to the establishment of and operation of any business regulated under this article    111594 location of adult uses a no business entity in which there is any adult use as provided in this article shall be located within 300 feet of any residential zoned property or any portion of a mixed use zoning district developed and utilized as residential or within 300 feet of any church school child care facility or public recreation area which is validly located or which has received legal authority to be located b no business entity in which there is any adult use as provided in this article shall be located within 300 feet of any other adult use c the distance requirements under subsections a and b of this section shall be measured along a straight line from the nearest residential zoning district or the nearest property line of the church school child care facility public recreation area or adult use to the closest property line of the adult use in a multitenant or multiuser building such as a shopping center the distance requirement shall be measured from the closest portion of the building or structure utilized by the adult use d an adult use shall not be located or permitted on the same premises as a use or business entity that is licensed to sell or serve alcoholic beverages e nothing in this section shall be construed to permit the operation of any business or the performance of any activity prohibited under any other section of this nothing in this article shall be construed to authorize allow or permit the establishment of any business the performance of any activity or the possession of any item which is obscene under the judicially established definition of obscenity    111594   52196 public nudity it shall be unlawful for any person in any public place or in any commercial establishment unless expressly permitted within the corporate limits of the city to be found in a state of nudity or to expose or exhibit his sexual organs or expose specified anatomical areas this section however shall not be construed to prohibit the exposure of sexual organs in restrooms or in any other place provided or set aside for that purpose this section shall not be construed to prohibit the wearing of bathing attire on the city beaches this section shall not be construed to prohibit a mother breastfeeding her baby    111594 state law reference exposure of sexual organs fs  80003 secs 10371065 granting denying revoking renewing suspending and cancelling adult use licenses for proposed or existing adult use establishments and for ascertaining whether a suspected adult use establishment is licensed or whether a license establishment complies with or is complying with this section sections 10186 10187 10190 10191 1019310198 1022610232 and division 3 of this article the police department is responsible for all enforcement actions brought under sections 10226 and 1022810232 and division 3 of this article the department of planning and development shall assist the police department in its investigative responsibilities and shall initiate investigations and issue citations in their respective areas of responsibility c the chief of police is responsible for verifying information contained on an application pursuant to subsection 10187b for inspecting any proposed licensed or nonlicensed establishment in order to ascertain whether it is in compliance with applicable local ordinances and criminal statutes including the provisions set forth in sections 10226 1022810232 and 1023410245 and division 3 of this article d the department of planning and development is responsible for the inspection of licensed premises and premises for which application for a license is made to ascertain compliance with 1 all fire prevention codes statutes or ordinances in effect in the city  and 2 city and county health codes and applicable state laws and regulations e the department of planning and development is responsible for ascertaining whether an existing adult use or a proposed establishment for which application for a license is being made complies with all locational requirements of section 1035 of all other zoning regulations and other applicable land use laws of the city and if it complies issuing an approval in the form of a valid adult use permit pursuant to sections 10226 1022810232 and division 3 of this article f any employee of the departments referenced in subsections a e of this section who is authorized by the head of that department shall at any reasonable hour which term shall include all hours of operation of the adult entertainment establishment have access to and shall have the right to inspect the premises of all licensees under this article for compliance with any or all of the applicable codes statutes ordinances and regulations in effect in the city and within the responsibilities of their respective departments as outlined in subsections a e of this section such employee shall require strict compliance with this article reports of violations shall be reported to the department of planning and development    111594 suit for violations in addition to any penalties for violation of this article the city can decisions any decision of department of planning and development pursuant to division 3 of this article shall be reviewed as a matter of right by the circuit court upon the filing of an appropriate pleading by an aggrieved party within 30 days of the action so taken by department of planning and development    111594 penalties and enforcement a whomever violates any section of this article shall be prosecuted and punished as provided by section 114 in all matters involving any violation of this article the burden of proof to establish that violation shall be with the city or applicable city department b in addition to the penalty provided for in section 114 adult bookstores adult theaters special cabarets physical culture establishments or adult photographic or modeling studios not in conformity with the requirements shall be subject to the appropriate civil action including injunctive relief in the court of appropriate jurisdiction for their abatement each day that any irreparable or irreversible violation is committed shall constitute a separate offense violations of general provisions is subsections 1022657 or the applicable special requirements of sections 10229 shall constitute separate offenses after the time period under subsection 10197a has lapsed c it is the responsibility of the licensee owner employee or operator of an adult use business establishment to ensure compliance with this article notwithstanding the issuance of an occupational license building permit zoning clearance or any other governmental permit d if the event the city attorney is required to participate in the prosecution of any violation of this article or if the city attorney is required to engage in any civil action including but not limited to proceedings for injunction or to recover damages the holder of the adult use permit involved in such action by the city attorney shall be required to reimburse the city for all attorneys fees paid by the city further any adult use permit holder by applying for and accepting an adult use permit shall have agreed to and accepted this subsection  2511 2594   111594   111594 rebuttable presumptions  affirmative defenses in prosecutions for violations of section 10236 10241 or 10242 it is a rebuttable presumption where relevant that the person with whom the charged individual is alleged to have performed the prohibited act is not an employee it is an affirmative defense where applicable that individuals involved in the alleged violation are employees of the adult entertainment establishment or adult use with whom the otherwise prohibited act is allowed    111594 secs 107310100  reserved division 3  employee of adult use business permit required unless specifically excluded in this division it shall be unlawful establishment licensed or permitted to operate under this article unless and until such person shall have first obtained an adult entertainment permit or temporary permit from the director of planning and development a   111594 violations any person who violates this division or otherwise fails to secure a permit as required by this division shall be prosecuted and punished in accordance with general law g   111594 application a all employees of an adult entertainment establishment shall file an application for an adult entertainment permit with the director of planning and development b there shall be submitted with each application for a permit proof of the applicants age such proof shall be provided by production of the applicants drivers license or passport or certified copy of his birth certificate if the applicant is unable to furnish such documents a certificate from the public school authorities as to the age of the applicant upon entering school as required by fs  23203 or the school authorities of the state where applicant enrolled in school shall be submitted upon inability of the applicant to establish a birth date the date shall be established in the order of preference as provided by fs  23203 however uncertified copies of such documents shall not be accepted c any applicant who does not possess a drivers license passport or certified copy of his birth certificate may obtain a temporary permit upon completion of all other requirements for an applicant and submission of a written request to the appropriate authority in his state of birth that certified evidence of his date of birth be provided to the department of planning and development d any adult entertainment establishment holding a valid adult entertainment license issued pursuant to this article shall be permitted to provide its employees with current permit applicant forms approved by the director of planning and development and to take the photograph of the applicant in a manner and with equipment approved by the city manager on the condition that the establishment 1 require the employee to complete the application form and be photographed within one working day of the time the employee begins to work or perform in the establishment  2 mail a notice in writing to the director of planning and development within one working day that the employee has begun to work or perform at the establishment  3 make the employee available for fingerprinting at a time and location to be determined by an agent appointed by the director of planning and development at which time and place the employee shall present to the agent the employees completed applicant form and photograph  4 on the first monday of every month provide the department of planning and development with a current listing of all employees and their positions  5 in exchange for acceptance of the benefits provided by this subsection waive any and all rights to challenge the permit requirements of this article  6 reimburse the city for reasonable additional expenses incurred pursuant to this subsection  and 7 be liable for damages to the city of $25000 per day per violation if any employee who performs in the establishment is not entitled to a permit c2 6 8   111594 age employees of a licensee on a premises licensed under this article shall not be less than 18 years of age b   111594 fee every application for a permit required under this division shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable fee established by resolution of the city commission and which is in appendix a to this c3   111594 health the director of planning and development shall submit the name of every applicant for an adult entertainment permit who intends to work in an adult establishment to the county health department if in the 30 days immediately preceding submission of an application such applicant was a known carrier of any notifiable communicable disease as defined in chapter 10d3 florida administrative the county health department shall notify the director of planning and development and no permit shall be issued unless and until the applicant presents a statement from a licensed physician certifying that the applicant is free of all notifiable communicable diseases any person applying for an adult entertainment permit shall be deemed to have consented to having the county health department notify the director of planning and development if the applicant is a known carrier of a notifiable communicable disease and shall be deemed to and shall have waived any right he may have to maintain the privacy or confidentiality of such information c4   111594 temporary permit issuance at the time an applicant applies for a permit required under this division and completes all requirements for the issuance of a permit he shall be issued a temporary permit valid for seven days no later than seven days from the filing of an application and if applicable upon presentation of the statement of a
