licensed physician as required in section 10106 the department of planning and development shall issue a permit c5   111594 issuance a under this division it shall be the duty of the director of planning and development to issue the applicant a written permit which shall be signed by the director and shall bear the name all aliases address sex age signature and photograph of the applicant the director of planning and development shall request an applicant to provide such additional information as is necessary to effect the purposes of this article upon delivery of the permit to the applicant the applicant shall be entitled to begin working on the licensed premises as a permanent employee b no permit shall be issued when its issuance would violate a statute ordinance law or when an order from a court of law prohibits the applicant from obtaining an adult entertainment permit in the city c6 7   111594 possession required a it shall be unlawful for an employee as defined in this article to work perform or to exhibit or display specified anatomical areas in an adult entertainment establishment without an adult entertainment permit in immediate possession at all times b no person charged with violating this division shall be convicted if the person produces to the director of planning and development within 72 hours of detention or in court a permit theretofore issued c upon receipt of a properly authenticated notification from the director of planning and development verifying issuance of a valid permit the clerk of the court is authorized to dismiss such case at any time prior to the defendants appearance in court f   111594 expiration and renewal a permit issued under this division shall expire two years from the date of issuance a permittee under this division shall be entitled to a renewal of the permit as a matter of course except when the permit has been suspended or revoked upon presentation of the previous permit or presentation of an affidavit as to its loss or destruction to the director of planning and development and payment of a fee made payable to the city the fee shall be established by resolution of the city commission and is listed in appendix a to this e   111594 revocation if a permit required under this division shall be issued as a result of false information misrepresentations of fact or mistake of fact it shall be revoked d   111594 suspension a procedure upon receiving notice that a jury or other trier of fact in a court of law has found that a person who has been issued a permit under this division violated any section of this article whether or not an adjudication of guilt has been entered the department of planning and development shall suspend the permit and notice of the suspension shall be sent to the address on the permit application which shall be considered the correct address b periods of suspension a single violation of this article shall result in the suspension of the adult entertainment permit for 30 days upon a second violation of this article within a period of two years from the date of a prior violation of this article but not including any time during which the permit was suspended the permit shall be suspended for 90 days upon a third violation of this article within a period of two years from the first of three violations but not including any time during which the permit was suspended the permit shall be suspended for 180 days all periods of suspension shall begin on the 15th day from the date the department of planning and development mails a notice of suspension to the permittee or on the date the permittee delivers the permit to the department of planning and development whichever comes first c surrender of permit required if a permittee after having been mailed notice of the suspension of the permit in the manner provided in this section fails to surrender the permit to the department of planning and development within 15 days the period of suspension of the permit shall be extended and shall not expire until a period has elapsed after the date of surrender of the permit or after the date of expiration of the permit whichever comes first which is identical in length with the original period of suspension h   111594 appeal under this division if an application for a permit is denied or if a permit is suspended or revoked the procedures specified in section 10199 shall be available to the applicant or permittee in the manner therein specified if the applicant or permittee does not appeal the denial suspension or revocation of a permit the applicant or permittee shall be deemed to have failed to have exhausted the administrative remedies i   111594 change of address name or place of employment whenever any person after applying for or receiving an adult entertainment permit required under this division shall move from the residential address named in such application or in the permit issued to such person or when the name of the permittee is changed by marriage or otherwise or when the permittee takes on employment or begins to perform at an adult entertainment establishment not indicated in the persons application such person shall within ten days thereafter notify the department of planning and development in writing of such persons old and new address or of such former and new names k   111594 replacement of lost permits under this division replacement of a lost permit shall be obtained by completing an application as required in sections 10103 and 1010510107 every application for a replacement permit shall be accompanied by a fee which shall be established by resolution of the city commission and which is listed in appendix a to this j   111594 secs 1011610145  reserved division 4  adult use business permit required no adult use business shall be allowed to commence or continue to operate without first obtaining a valid adult use permit any person desiring to locate operate or continue operation of any adult use shall be required to obtain an adult use permit from the director of planning and development before the establishment or commencement of business as an adult use a   111594 application the applicant for an adult use business permit shall complete an application on forms supplied by the department of planning and development for a permit to operate an adult entertainment establishment which provides the following information 1 if the applicant is an individual the applicants legal name as well as any aliases if the applicant is a partnership the full name of all partners whether general or limited as well as any and all aliases of the partners if the applicant is a corporation the exact corporate name and state of incorporation and the names and aliases of all officers directors and stockholders 2 the name under which the business is to be operated and a general description of the services or goods to be provided 3 the telephone number of the business 4 the street address of the proposed or existing adult use 5 legal description of the property occupied by the proposed or existing adult use including the property boundaries 6 a map showing the known locations of any churches schools child care facilities public recreation facilities or other existing or proposed adult uses within approximately 300 feet of the proposed or existing adult use location for which the adult use permit is being sought 7 if the applicant is not the record owner of the subject parcel inclusion of a letter with the notarized signature of the record owner purporting to be the record owner and stating the applicant is authorized to seek an adult use permit for the premises 8 a plan or diagram showing the configuration of the premises including a statement of the total floor area to be occupied by the adult use business in relation to the gross floor area the plan or diagram need not be professionally prepared but must be drawn to a designated scale site and development plans shall comply with article iv of chapter 134 9 disclosure of any criminal convictions within the previous five years of the owner manager clerk or operator partner officer directors or stockholders as defined in subsection 1 of this section b2   111594 fee a in order to obtain an adult use business permit the applicant shall remit to the city a fee for each adult entertainment establishment permit that is issued which fee shall be separate and distinct from business licenses occupational licenses or other building licenses or fees the fee shall be set by the city commission and shall be reasonably calculated to cover the costs of administrating the permitting requirements of this division and shall not be refundable if the application is rejected b the annual application fee for an adult use business permit shall be as established by resolution of the city commission which fee may be changed from time to time as deemed appropriate by the city commission and which is included in appendix a to this b1 258   111594 criteria for issuance a upon receipt of a completed application for the permit required under this division the director of planning and development or his designee or any person designated by the city manager shall inspect the proposed location of the adult use  shall check the distance between the lot lines of the adult entertainment establishment and any other adult entertainment establishment church school residential zoned district residential use within a multiuse zoning district or public recreation area  and shall check the total floor space occupied by the adult use aspect of the business in relation to the total floor area of the business b the director of planning and development may but only with the written consent of the applicant extend that period of time for purposes of clarification of issues raised by the review but in no event shall the time be extended for a period of time in excess of 45 days c the city shall have a check made by the police department for any convictions within the previous five years of any owner manager clerk operator partner officer director or stockholder of the applicant for any of the following crimes 1 sexual battery fs   et seq 2 prostitution fs ch 796 3 lewdness fs  80002 et seq 4 sexual abuse of child fs   et seq 5 incest fs  82604 6 commercial exploitation of nudity section 666 et seq of this d no permit shall be issued if any owner manager clerk operator partner officer director or stockholder of the applicant has been convicted within the previous five years of any of the crimes outlined in this section ce   111594 issuance of certificate of compliance or noncompliance a generally inspection in the review of the application as stated in this division shall be completed and the city shall issue within 45 days a certificate of compliance or a certificate of noncompliance b certification of noncompliance 1 when it is found that the location proposed in the application does not meet the distance requirements of subsection 1035a or is one where a valid adult use exists or is one where a valid adult use permit or valid certification of compliance has been issued for another adult use the location of which is within the distance requirements of subsection 1035b from the proposed location the applicant shall be notified of the certification of noncompliance of the proposed location with the locational requirements of this article 2 upon receipt of the certification of noncompliance the applicant shall have ten days to appeal the decision on noncompliance pursuant to section 10157 c certification of compliance 1 when it is found that the applicants proposed location meets the distance requirement of subsection 1035a and where no valid adult use exists or where no valid adult use permit or valid certification of compliance has been issued for another adult use the location of which is within the distance requirements of subsection 1035b from the proposed location the applicant shall be notified of the certification of compliance of the proposed location with the locational requirements of subsections 1035a and b 2 upon notification the applicant shall have 20 days to obtain the adult use permit signed by the director of planning and development or his designee failure to obtain that permit within the 20day time period invalidates the certification of compliance and the applicant must reapply f1 2   111594 conflicting applications a the city commission recognizes the potential of creating nonconformities by granting adult use business permits that conflict because the applications are submitted at the same time and the applicants seek permits for the same location or for a location which if permitted under this division would render the other location unusable the director of planning and development shall develop a system for tracking potentially conflicting applications and for ranking them by date and time of applicationdate of establishment b between two applications being processed at the same time which individually qualify under subsections 1035a and b but would violate subsection 1035b if both were to receive permits the application which was completed at the earliest date as provided in sections 10147 and 10148 shall be notified that the applicants proposed location has been certified in compliance pursuant to subsection 10150c applications shall be processed on a first come first served basis if properly received and properly completed c the conflicting applicant shall be notified of the applications certification of noncompliance pursuant to subsection 10150b with the notation that the noncompliance was due to the earlier submittal of a conflicting application d the first applicant who has received the certification of compliance shall have 20 days to secure the adult use permit signed by the director of planning and development if the period of validity of the certification of compliance expires pursuant to subsection 10150c2 the applicant must reapply e any applicant who has received a certification of noncompliance pursuant to subsection 10150b may use the applicants prior application date in a resubmission for the purposes of establishing the prior date if the original application was made no more than seven months previous otherwise the applicant shall submit a new application f3   111594 contents all permits issued under this division shall contain a legend on the back or reverse which shall state as follows the undersigned permit holder acknowledges that the secondary effects of the operation of an adult entertainment facility are so adverse that should the holder of this permit or any of hishertheirits agents and employees violate any of the provisions of a1 2 or 3 or permit a violation to exist knowingly or otherwise on the premises of said adult use facility then the city of st pete beach shall be entitled to issue a cease and desist order as specified by b of this   and further the city shall be entitled to revoke the permit issued herewith and direct that said adult usage be terminated immediately upon issuance of any order of revocation by the city s permit holder f7   111594 validity a the adult use permit issued under this division signed by the director of planning and development shall be valid for a period of six months after issuance during which time the applicants adult use business must either operate as an adult use or the necessary building permits to establish the adult use business must have been obtained the validity of such a permit shall be extended by the director of planning and development one time for 90 days for good cause shown any decision to deny such an extension may be appealed pursuant to the provisions of section 10157 b once established the adult use permit shall remain valid unless revoked by the director of planning and development or the adult use has been voluntarily discontinued for a period of 30 days or more c decisions by the director of planning and development to revoke an otherwise valid adult use permit may be appealed pursuant to section 10157 f4   111594 transferability a permit required under this division shall be issued only in the name of the approved applicant and shall not be transferable to any person f5   111594 revocation and cease and desist order a the city shall be entitled to and shall in fact be obligated to issue a cease and desist order to any person holding a permit under this division requiring the permit holder to immediately cease and desist operation of the adult entertainment establishment authorized in accordance with this article and additionally and not as an alternative to the cease and desist order the city shall revoke the permit of any permit holder for any one or more of the reasons set forth as follows 1 the owner or operator of the permitted business knowingly allowed a person under the age of 18 years of age to be an employee of the adult use business or should have known after reasonable inquiry that the employee was under the age of 18 years 2 the owner of the permitted business knowingly gave false fraudulent or untruthful information on the application for such a permit 3 the conviction of the owner manager clerk or operator partner officer director or stockholder of any criminal violation related to the operation of the adult use business b the cease and desist order shall be issued in order to protect the health welfare and safety of the citizens of the city from any of the secondary effects of the adult use the order shall specify the reason for its issuance and shall also set a time and place for a hearing before an administrative hearing officer selected by the city manager in order to determine whether or not the permit shall be revoked the administrative hearing officer shall hold the hearing required under this subsection within ten business days from the date of the issuance of the cease and desist order at the hearing the city shall present such evidence as it deems appropriate to establish the nature of the offense and to establish the reasons for the cease and desist order the permit holder shall present such evidence as he deems appropriate thereafter the hearing officer shall determine whether to revoke the permit or to place such additional lawful restrictions on the permit holder as shall be necessary in order to ensure that no further violations of this article shall occur a permit holder may continue to operate until the hearing officer has rendered a decision a permit holder who continues to operate the adult entertainment facility after a revocation shall be subject to a fine of $50000 for each day of the violation which fine shall be determined by the hearing officer at a subsequent hearing any fine assessed by the hearing officer shall be recorded as a lien in the public records of the county and in any other county in which the permit holder may own real property or may operate an adult entertainment facility and shall be subject to enforcement and collection in the same manner as any mechanics lien may be enforced in accordance with fs ch 713 including the right to collect a reasonable attorneys fee by applying for and accepting an adult use permit the permit holder agrees to be bound by any and all decisions rendered by the hearing officer the administrative hearing officer shall conduct a fair and impartial hearing keeping in mind the requirement of providing due process of law to all parties in any proceeding regarding revocation of a permit or regarding a cease and desist order the burden of proof shall be with the city or the applicable city department f6   111594 variances a if an applicant receives a certification of noncompliance because the location of the proposed adult use is in violation of the locational requirements of this article and if the applicant wishes to seek a variance from these locational requirements the applicant shall not later than ten calendar days after receiving notice of the certification of noncompliance file with department of planning and development a written request for a variance from the locational restrictions of section 1035 b if the written request is filed with the director of planning and development within the tenday limit the director shall schedule a hearing before the citys appropriate board of authority which body shall consider the request for a variance the department of planning and development shall set a date for the hearing within 60 days from the date the written request is received c the appropriate board of authority shall hear and consider evidence offered by any interested person in a public hearing scheduled with public notice public notice shall be pursuant to the requirements of the governmentinthesunshine manual the appropriate board of authority may in its discretion grant a variance with reasonable conditions from the locational restrictions of section 1035 if it makes the following findings 1 a sufficient physical barrier separates the adult use establishment for which a variance is being sought from the land use which has caused the adult use not to be in compliance with the distance requirement of this article so as to substantially fulfill the purpose of the distance requirement such physical barriers include but are not limited to limited access streets or highways walls natural or manmade waterways 2 the strict application of this article will work an undue hardship unique to the applicant for a particular location 3 all other applicable sections of this article will be observed d the appropriate board of authority shall only grant a variance to this article by the affirmative vote of four members failure to reach a fourmember vote shall result in a denial of the variance the decision of the appropriate board of authority shall be final e if appropriate board of authority denies the variance the applicant shall not be entitled to reapply until at least six months have elapsed since the date of the boards action f the grant of a variance does not exempt the applicant from any other sections of this article other than the locational restrictions of section 1035    111594 appeals notwithstanding any other section of this ordinance or section of this article appeals shall be subject to the following 1 the appropriate board of authority shall have the authority to hear appeals from decisions made by the department of planning and development pursuant to subsections 1035a and b or section 10156 2 applications for appeals of the decisions shall be submitted to the department of planning and development applications need not be in any particular form but should reference the application reference number and generally the basis for appeal of the decision 3 the written notice of appeal shall be submitted within seven days of the official notification by the city of its finding the appropriate board of authority shall consider the appeal and shall issue its finding within 60 days after receipt of the written notice of appeal    111594 secs 1015810185  reserved division 5  license required  classification a generally 1 no adult entertainment establishment shall be permitted to operate within the corporate limits without first having been granted an adult use license under this article unless otherwise exempted 2 provided it is not in violation of chapter 134 pertaining to zoning an adult entertainment establishment shall be granted a conditional right to operate within ten days of filing an application for an adult entertainment license the conditional right to operate shall be valid for so long a time as is necessary for the director of planning and development to issue or to deny issuance of the license the applicants conditional right to operate shall terminate five days after the mailing of a notice of denial or preliminary denial by the director of planning and development as provided in section 10190 further issuance of a conditional permit shall not obligate the city or the department of planning and development to grant any other permit for an adult entertainment establishment prior to issuance of a conditional permit the holder for such permit shall be required to sign a written statement to the effect that the permit holder understands the permit is conditional and shall not be reissued or given permanent status b classifications any adult use shall be classified as follows 1 an adult bookstore or adult video store 2 adult dancing establishment 3 adult motel 4 adult theater which shall include adult arcades places or buildings having adult motion picture booths places or buildings having a hall or auditorium for the presentation of film material and places designed to permit viewing by patrons seated in automobiles 5 adult photographic studio or modeling studio 6 adult massage establishment 7 physical culture establishment or special cabaret or any combination of these uses based on the information in the application subject to subsequent inspection for verification 8 adult bottle club c contents each application for a license shall state the classification and location for which it is to be issued a license shall be issued for only one location and for only one classification of adult entertainment as defined in subsection b of this section at a single location    111594 application a required any individual partnership or corporation desiring to operate an adult use establishment shall file with the department of planning and development a sworn license application and a standard application form supplied by the department of planning and development b contents the completed application shall contain the following information and shall be accompanied by the following documents 1 if the applicant is a an individual the individual shall state his legal name and any aliases and submit satisfactory proof that he is 18 years of age  b a partnership the partnership shall state its complete name and the names of all partners having either direct managerial supervisory or advisory responsibilities for daytoday operations of the adult use and whether the partnership is general or limited  or c a corporation the corporation shall state its complete name the date of its incorporation evidence that the corporation is in good standing the names and capacity of all officers directors and stockholders having either direct managerial supervisory or advisory responsibilities for daytoday operations of the adult use and if applicable the name of the registered corporate agent and the address of the registered office for service of process 2 if the applicant intends to conduct the establishment under a name other than that of the applicant the establishments fictitious name and a certified copy of the applicants registration with the division of corporations of the department of state under fs  86509 3 whether the applicant or any of the other individuals listed pursuant to subsection b1 of this section have within the fiveyear period immediately preceding the date of the application been convicted of a specified criminal act and if so the specified criminal act involved the date of conviction and the place of conviction 4 whether the applicant or any of the other individuals listed pursuant to subsection b1 or 2 of this section have had a previous license or permit under this article or any other ordinance regulating adult uses suspended or revoked or has been by any federal or state court order required to cease operation including the name and location of the establishment for which the license was suspended or revoked as well as the date of the suspension or revocation and whether the applicant or any other individuals listed pursuant to subsection b1 has been a partner in a partnership or an officer director or principal stockholder of a corporation whose license under this article or any other ordinance regulating adult uses has previously been suspended or revoked including the name and location of the establishment for which the license was suspended or revoked as well as the date of the suspension or revocation 5 whether the applicant or any other individuals listed pursuant to subsection b1 of this section hold any other license under this article and if so the name and location of such other licensed establishment 6 the general nature of the type of adult use for which the applicant is seeking a license including a statement concerning the degree to which the anticipated activities at the adult use meet the definitions of the enumerated adult use classifications listed in subsection 10186b such a characterization shall serve as an initial basis for the permitted activities allowed under the license issued as well a basis for the fee charged 7 the location of the proposed establishment including a legal description of the property site and a legal street address 8 the names of the employees for the proposed established if known or if presently unknown or there will be no employees a statement to that effect 9 the applicants current mailing address current residential address and current residential telephone number 10 a site plan of the proposed or existing establishment a professionally prepared diagram in the nature of an engineers or architects blueprint shall not be required  however each site plan should be oriented to the north or to some designated street or object and should be drawn to a designated scale or with marked dimensions sufficient to show the various internal dimensions of all areas of the interior of the premises to an accuracy of plus or minus six inches the site plan shall include but not be limited to the following a all property lines rightsofway and the location of buildings parking areas and spaces curb cuts and driveways b all windows doors entrances and exits fixed structural features walls stairs partitions projection booths admission booths adult booths concession booths stands food service equipment counters and similar structures c all proposed improvements or enlargements to be made which shall be indicated and calculated in terms of percentage of increase in floor size d designation of any portion of the premises in which patrons will not be permitted e a statement as to whether a proposed establishment is constructed in a manner that varies from the site plan submitted a supplemental site plan showing the existing facility shall be provided once the certificate of occupancy or final building permit inspection is completed 11 a recent photograph of the individuals listed pursuant to subsection b1 of this section 12 either the drivers license number or the state or federally issued identification card number of the individuals listed pursuant to subsection b1 of this section 13 a valid adult use permit signed by the director of planning and development or his designee pursuant to this article 14 a sworn statement attesting to the accuracy of the information provided in the application and to the fact that the applicant as licensee will own possess operate and exercise control over the proposed or existing adult use establishment c application fee 1 the applicant for any adult use establishment shall pay to the department of planning and development and prior to the application for a license a fee in an amount to cover the expenses of the zoning review necessary to obtain an adult use permit pursuant to sections 10226 and 1022810232 and division 3 of this article the amount of the fee shall be established by resolution of the city commission and is listed in appendix a to this fee shall be paid only one time for any proposed adult use location unless the proposal is to expand the dimensions of a permitted adult use 2 in addition to the zoning review fee required in subsection c1 of this section each application for an adult use license shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable fee in an amount established by resolution of the city commission and listed in appendix a to this fee is required to offset the cost of processing the application if the application for a license is approved and a license is granted the fee shall be applied as a credit toward the annual license fee required for the first year pursuant to section 10193 d incomplete application if the department of planning and development determines at any time that the applicant has not properly completed the application for a proposed establishment the department of planning and development shall promptly notify the applicant of such fact and shall allow the applicant ten days to properly complete the application the time period for granting or denying a license under section 10190 shall be stayed during the period in which the applicant is allowed an opportunity to properly complete the application    111594 false statement or false information it shall be a violation of this article for any person applying for an adult use license to make a false statement which is intended to facilitate the issuance of a license or to provide false information which is intended to facilitate the issuance of a license    111594 investigation of applicant upon receipt of an application under this division properly filed with the department of planning and development and upon payment of the nonrefundable application fee the department of planning and development shall immediately stamp the application as received and shall immediately thereafter send photocopies of the application to the chief of police the police chiefs representatives shall promptly conduct an investigation of the applicant and of the individuals listed in the application pursuant to subsection 10187b to ascertain the validity of the information provided in the application at the conclusion of its investigation the police department shall indicate on the photocopy of the application the results of its investigation a copy of the application shall also be forwarded to the director of planning and development who shall determine whether the plan for the licensed premises complies with the requirements of this other applicable laws and regulations relating to construction safety fire protection zoning and public health    111594 issuance  denial a time limits under this division the department of planning and development shall grant or deny an application for a license within 45 days from the date of its proper filing upon the expiration of the 45th day the applicant shall be permitted to begin operating the establishment for which a license is sought without benefit of a license unless and until the department of planning and development notifies the applicant of a denial of the application and states the reason for that denial failure to timely grant or deny an application for a license under this section allowing operation without benefit of a license shall not serve as a granting of a license but shall serve to ripen an appropriate action to compel a decision on the application all operations of the establishments authorized under this special provision shall conform to sections 1033 10671070 and 1022610232 and division 3 of this article during the pendency of the application review b issuance if there is no basis for denial pursuant to subsection c of this section the department of planning and development shall grant the application notify the applicant of the granting and issue the license to the applicant upon payment of the appropriate annual license fee provided in section 10193 with credit as provided in section 10187c c denial the department of planning and development shall deny the application for any of the following reasons 1 the application contains material false information or information material to the decision was omitted failure to list an individual required to be listed pursuant to subsection 10187b and whose listing would result in a denial pursuant to subsections c2 and 4 of this section is presumed to be a material false information for purposes of denial of the application the certification that the licensee owns possesses operates and exercises control over the proposed or existing adult use establishment is a material representation for purposes of this section 2 the applicant or any of the other individuals listed pursuant to subsection 10187b1 holds or has held a license under this article or any other ordinance regulating adult uses in the city that has been suspended or revoked for reasons implicating the purposes and intent of this article 3 the granting of the application would violate a state or federal statute or city or applicable county ordinance or an order from a court of law 4 an applicant or any of the other individuals listed pursuant to subsection 10187b1 has been convicted of a specified criminal act a for which 1 less that two years has elapsed since the date of conviction or the date of release from confinement imposed for the conviction whichever is the later date if the conviction is of a misdemeanor offense  2 less that five years has elapsed since the date of conviction or the date of release from confinement imposed for the conviction whichever is the later date if the conviction is of a felony offense  or 3 less than five years has elapsed since the date of the last conviction or the date of release from confinement imposed for the conviction whichever is the later date if the convictions are of two or more misdemeanor offenses or combination of misdemeanor offenses occurring within any 24month period b the fact that a conviction is being appealed shall have no effect on the disqualification of the applicant except that if a conviction is overturned this shall be treated as if there were no such conviction c an applicant who has been convicted of a specified criminal act may seek to qualify for an adult use license only when the time period required by subsection c4 of this section has elapsed 5 if the department of planning and development denies the application the applicant shall be notified of the denial and the reason for the denial shall be specified upon the application or in a separate writing notification shall be by certified mail and shall be sent to the address on the license application which shall be considered the correct address for all notices 6 if a person applies for a license at a particular location within a period of six months from the date of denial of a previous application for a license at that location and there has not been an intervening change in the circumstances material to the decision regarding the former reason for denial the application shall not be accepted for consideration the burden of showing an intervening change of circumstances shall be on the applicant 7 the granting of a license does not act as a certification that the proposed adult use establishment meets all sections of this article or of any health or zoning statute code ordinance or regulation the adult use establishment and any proposed adult use establishment once established must meet all required of all regulated businesses including the provisions for adult uses of sections 10226 and 1022810232 and division 3 of this article 8 within 15 days after the mailing of a notice of denial of an application for a license or a notification of the revocation of a license the applicant or licensee may take an appeal as provided in section 10199 if the administrative hearing officer finds that the application should be approved he shall so order and upon payment of the appropriate license fee the director of planning and development shall issue the license if the administrative hearing officer finds that the license should not have been revoked he shall notify the director of planning and development who shall reissue the license    111594 contents  limitations  term  renewal expiration  cancellation a contents an adult use license shall state on its face the name of the licensee the name of the establishment the street address of the establishment the classification of the license the date of issuance and the date of expiration b limitations no more than one license shall be issued and in effect for any single location within the city a licensed premises may be owned by the licensee or may be leased by the licensee from a person not a licensee under this article provided that a licensee who is a tenant or lessee shall not surrender his tenancy or lease to the owner or lessor if by doing so the owner or lessor will take possession control and operation of the licensed premises and the business licensed under this article unless the license is transferred as provided in section 10195 a licensee who is the owner of the licensed premises shall not lease or otherwise give up possession control and operation of the licensed premises and the business licensed under this article to any other individual partnership or corporation unless the license is transferred as provided in section 10195 c term every license issued under this division shall be an annual license which shall commence running on october 1 on which date they shall have been paid for and shall expire on september 30 of the following year if a license is issued after october 1 but by march 31 of the following year the applicant may obtain a new license upon application therefor and the payment of the appropriate license fee and such license shall expire on the following september 30 if a license is issued after march 31 but by october 1 of the same year the applicant shall pay onehalf the appropriate license fee required for the annual license and such license shall expire on september 30 of the same year this subsection shall not affect section 10195 d renewals all licenses issued under this division shall be renewed annually subject to other sections of this a licensee under this article shall be entitled to a renewal of his annual license from year to year as a matter of course by october 1 by presenting the license for the previous year or satisfactory evidence of its loss or destruction to the director of planning and development and by paying the appropriate license fee and updating the information supplied with the latest application or certifying that the information supplied remains unchanged e expiration a license that is not renewed under this article on or before october 1 of each year shall expire f cancellation all expired licenses not renewed on or before october 1 shall be cancelled summarily by the department of planning and development unless such license is involved in litigation and the city is legally prevented from cancelling it by order or a court of competent jurisdiction    111594 alteration it shall be a violation of this article for any person to alter or otherwise change the contents of an adult use license without the written permission of the department of planning and development    111594 annual regulatory fees a levied in order to cover the administrative and enforcement costs associated with this article there are levied annual licensing regulatory fees under this article for an adult entertainment establishment in amounts set by resolution of the city commission and listed in appendix a to this fees shall be charged for each establishment proposing to operate or operating only as 1 an adult theater which shall pay licensing regulatory fees for the following a having only adult booths a fee for each booth  b having only a hall or auditorium for each seat  c having only an area outdoors designed to permit viewing by customers seated in vehicles for each parking space  or d having a combination of two or more of the items listed in subsections a1a1c of this section the cumulative license fee applicable to each under subsections a1a1c of this section 2 a special adult cabaret 3 an adult photographic studio 4 a physical culture establishment 5 an adult bookstorevideo store 6 an adult use which cannot be categorized according to the categories in subsections a1 5 of this section shall be assessed at the rate applicable to the adult use most closely resembling the proposed or existing use b purpose the annual license fees collected under this section are declared to be regulatory fees which are collected for the purpose of examination and inspection of adult uses under this article and the administration thereof these regulatory fees are in addition to and not in lieu of the occupational license taxes building permit zoning food establishment fees or other fees imposed by other sections of this    111594 records and reports  consent by licensee a records and reports each licensee under this division shall keep such records and make such reports as are required under this article whenever the information required by or provided under subsection 10187b1 has changed the licensee shall promptly provide the department of planning and development with the changed information b consent by holding a license under this article the licensee shall be deemed to have consented to the requirements of this article and to the exercise by the department of planning and development and other departments of their respective responsibilities under this article    111594 transferability a requirements a licensee under this division shall not transfer his license to another business entity or person and thereby surrender ownership possession control and operation of the licensed establishment to such other business entity or person unless and until such other business entity or person satisfies the following requirements 1 the business entity or person obtains an amendment to the license from the department of planning and development which indicates the name of the new licensee which amendment may be obtained only upon completion and proper filing of an application with the department of planning and development setting forth the information called for under subsection 10187b1 14 with respect to the new applicant and that application has been granted by the department of planning and development pursuant to section 10190  and 2 the business entity or person pays the application fee and a transfer fee of ten percent of the appropriate annual license fee licenses issued under this division shall not be transferable in any way other than provided in this subsection b effect of suspension or revocation procedures no license may be transferred pursuant to subsection a of this section when the department of planning and development has notified the licensee that suspension or revocation proceedings have been or will be brought against the licensee c transfer to different location a licensee shall not transfer his license to another location d attempting improper transfer any attempted transfer of a license either directly or indirectly in violation of this section is declared void and the license shall be deemed abandoned and shall automatically terminate the department of planning and development shall give notice of the cancellation of the license    111594 changing name of establishment under this division no licensee shall change the name of an adult use establishment unless and until the licensee satisfies each of the following requirements 1 gives the department of planning and development 30 days notice in writing of the proposed name change  2 pays the department of planning and development a change of name fee which fee shall be established by resolution of the city commission and is listed in appendix a to this   and 3 complies with fs  86509 and has so notified the department of planning and development of such compliance    111594 suspension a violation of general requirements an adult use establishment license may be suspended as follows 1 if the department of planning and development learns or finds upon sufficient cause that a licensed adult use establishment is operating contrary to the respective general requirements of section 10226 or the applicable special requirements of sections 10228 it shall promptly notify the licensee of the violation and shall allow the licensee a tenday period in which to correct the violation filing of an application to the appropriate board of authority for a variance under section 10156 shall toll the running of the time period the appropriate board of authority shall in its conditions for any variance provide for a specified period of time for correction of any violation consistent with the variance 2 if the licensee fails to so correct the violation before the expiration of the time period provided in subsection a1 of this section the department of planning and development shall forthwith suspend the license and shall notify the licensee of the suspension notification shall be by certified mail and shall be sent to the address on the license application which shall be considered the correct address 3 the suspension shall remain in effect until the department of planning and development is notified in writing that the violation of the section in question has been corrected the department of planning and development or another department of the city shall at their request respond to a request for inspection within 24 hours of receipt of such a request and shall within 12 hours of inspection notify the licensee that the violation has or has not been corrected the time periods in this subsection shall be exclusive of weekends and holidays 4 within 24 hours of receipt of notice that the violation has been corrected the department of planning and development shall notify the licensee that the suspension is lifted 5 during the suspension of the license an adult use establishment shall not operate as an adult use or pursuant to other applicable codes ordinances statute or court orders where applicable shall not be open for business b illegal transfer if the department of planning and development learns or finds upon sufficient cause that a licensee is engaged in a license transfer contrary to section 10195 the department of planning and development shall forthwith suspend the license and notify the licensee of the suspension the suspension shall remain in effect until the department of planning and development is satisfied that the requirements of section 10195 have been met c convictions for violations of certain sections 1 if three or more violations of a specified criminal act or violation of sections 10226 or 1022810232 or division 3 of this article occur at an adult use establishment within a twoyear period and convictions result from at least three of the violations of either the licensee the licensees operator or an employee or of any of the other individuals listed pursuant to subsection 10187b1 the department of planning and development shall upon the date of the third conviction suspend the license and notify the licensee of the suspension the suspension shall remain in effect for a period of 30 days 2 if one or more violations of a specified criminal act or violation of sections 10226 or 1022810232 or division 3 of this article occur at the adult use establishment within a period of two years from the date of the violation from which the conviction resulted for which the license was suspended for 30 days under subsection c1 of this section but not including any time during which the license was suspended for 30 days and a conviction results from one or more of the violations of either the licensee the licensees operator or employee or of any of the other individuals listed pursuant to subsection 10187b1 the department of planning and development shall upon the date of the first conviction suspend the license again and notify the licensee of the suspension the suspension shall remain in effect for a period of 90 days 3 if one or more violations of a specified criminal act or violation of sections 10226 or 1022810232 or division 3 of this article occur within a period of two years from the date of the violation from which the conviction resulted for which the license was suspended for 90 days under subsection c2 of this section but not including any time during which the license was suspended for 90 days and a conviction results from one or more of the violations of either the licensee the licensees operator or employee or of or any of the other individuals listed pursuant to subsection 10187b1 the department of planning and development shall upon the date of the first conviction suspend the license again and notify the licensee of the suspension the suspension shall remain in effect for period of 180 days 4 the transfer or renewal of a license pursuant to this article shall not defeat the terms of subsections c1 3 of this section d effective date of suspension all periods of suspension shall begin five days after the date the department of planning and development mails the notice of suspension to the licensee or on the date the licensee delivers his license to the department of planning and development whichever happens first    111594 cancellation or revocation a false information if the department of planning and development learns or finds upon sufficient cause that a license was granted under this division based upon material false information misrepresentation of material fact or mistake of fact or law it shall forthwith cancel the license and notify the licensee of the cancellation failure to list an individual required to be listed pursuant to subsection 10187b1 and whose listing would result in a denial pursuant to subsection 10190c1 c2 or c3 is presumed to be a material false information for purposes of cancellation of the permit  the certification that the licensee owns possesses operates and exercises control over the proposed or existing adult use establishment is a material representation for purposes of this section notification shall be by certified mail and shall be sent to the address on the license application which shall be considered the correct address b convictions for violation of certain sections 1 if one or more convictions for a specified criminal act or a conviction for violation of sections 10226 or 1022810232 or division 3 of this article of either the licensee the licensees operator or employee or any of the other individuals listed pursuant to subsection 10187b1 occur at an adult use establishment which has had a license suspended for a period of 180 days pursuant to subsection 10197c3 and the conviction occurs within a period of two years from the date of the violation from which the conviction resulted for which the license was suspended for 180 days but not including any time during which the license was suspended for 180 days the department of planning and development shall forthwith revoke the license and notify the licensee of the revocation 2 the transfer or renewal of a license pursuant to this article shall not defeat the terms of subsection b1 of this section c effect of revocation if a license is revoked the licensee shall not be allowed to obtain another adult use license for a period of ten years d effective date of revocation the revocation shall take effect five days after the date the department of planning and development mails the notice of revocation to the licensee or on the date the licensee delivers his license to the department of planning and development whichever happens first    111594 appeal a appeals alleging error in the denial suspension or revocation of a license or permit under this article shall be by petition for a hearing before an administrative hearing officer selected by the city manager or his designate b a notice of intent to appeal shall be filed with the city clerk within 15 days of the mailing of a notice of denial suspension or revocation of a license or permit thereafter and upon payment of a fee to cover administrative costs plus a deposit to cover the costs of the administrative hearing officer a hearing shall be scheduled within 30 days unless otherwise agreed to by the party filing the appeal the fee and deposit shall be established by resolution of the city commission and are listed in appendix a to this administrative hearing officer shall provide both the petitioning party and the city no less than a tenday written notice of the time for the hearing the hearing shall be held at city hall the city clerk shall give the petitioning party at least ten days written notice of the time and place for the hearing which hearing shall be set by the city commission    111594 secs 1020010225  reserved division 6  regulations general requirements each operator of an adult use establishment shall regardless of whether it is licensed observe the following general requirements 1 conform the establishment to all applicable building statutes codes ordinances and regulations whether federal state or local  2 conform the establishment to all applicable fire statutes codes ordinances and regulations whether federal state or local  3 conform the establishment to all applicable health statutes codes ordinances and regulations whether federal state or local  4 conform the establishment to all applicable zoning regulations and land use laws whether state or local specifically including chapter 134 of this to zoning  5 keep the adult use license posted in a conspicuous place at the adult use establishment at all times which license shall be available for inspection upon request at all times by the public  6 opaquely cover each nonopaque area a person outside the establishment may otherwise see inside the establishment provided that this subsection shall not apply if the uncovered glass area exposes to public view only a lobby or anteroom containing no material or activity other than a reception counter or desk and chairs or couches for customers to use while waiting  7 maintain a continuously updated compilation of the records required in section 10227  and 8 conform the establishment to the requirements of fs ch 381 and the rules and regulations of the state department of health made pursuant thereto each licensed premises shall be deemed to be a place serving the public for the purpose of sanitary facilities    111594 records for employees a the licensee of an adult use establishment is responsible for keeping a record of all employees who are employed by the establishment and of all former employees who were employed by the establishment during the preceding oneyear period the record shall contain the current or former employees full legal name including any aliases the employees date of birth residential address residential telephone number if any drivers license number or state or federally issued identification card number and a recent photograph of the current or former employee b the original records required by subsection a of this section or true and exact photocopies thereof shall be kept at the adult use establishment at all times c any operator of the adult use establishment shall be responsible for knowing the location of the original records or the true and exact photocopies thereof d any operator of the adult use establishment shall upon request by a law enforcement officer health department official or a representative of the department of planning and development make available for inspection the original records or the true and exact photocopies thereof while the establishment is open for business    111594 sanitation a all areas of each adult use accessible to patrons shall be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition the surfaces of all floors furniture countertops shades blinds vertical blinds doors and walls of areas accessible to patrons shall be cleaned and sanitized a minimum of one time each 24 hours with an industrial strength cleaner b all floors furniture countertops shades blinds vertical blinds doors and walls of areas accessible to patrons of an adult entertainment establishment subject to this article shall be renovated or be replaced as needed all furniture must be kept free from holes and rips c all toilet facilities must be of readily cleanable design and must be kept clean in good repair and free from objectionable odors restrooms must be vented to the outside of any building must be equipped with mechanical exhaust systems and must be well lighted floors shall be of impervious easily cleanable materials walls shall be smooth nonabsorbent and easily cleanable d an appropriate and effective adaptation of the us centers for disease controls universal precautions for the prevention of transmission of the hiv virus and other diseases shall be utilized for any individual cleaning or sanitizing of the areas accessible to patrons such procedure shall be reviewed and approved by the department of planning and development a copy of the approved procedure shall be kept on file at the adult entertainment establishment and a copy shall be provided to each person cleaning or sanitizing the areas accessible to the patrons each such individual shall certify that he has read and understood the procedures by signing a copy of the procedure the signed copy shall be kept as a part of the records of the adult entertainment establishment and open for inspection by the county health department police department and department of planning and development e the water supply must be adequate of safe sanitary quality and from an approved source in accordance with chapter 1722 of the florida administrative    111594 adult bookstorevideo store in addition to the general requirements for an adult use establishment contained in section 10226 an adult bookstorevideo store shall regardless of whether it is licensed observe the following special requirements 1 all materials devices and novelties and posters depicting books movies devices and novelties for sale or rental within the store or by the store shall be so displayed that they cannot be seen by anyone other than customers who have entered the licensed premises signage and posters visible from the outside of the store or in display windows shall not contain photographs or illustrations depicting sexual conduct sexual battery sexual bestiality masochism sadism sadomasochistic abuse sexually oriented material obscene material or material harmful to minors as defined in fs   2 if recordings are offered for sale and customers may listen to them while in the licensed premises soundproof booths or rooms shall be available for use by customers who have a desire to listen and the requirements of subsection 102312 shall be followed 3 adult bookstoresvideo stores that only sell or rent adult material and have no adult booththeater component are exempt from sections 10101 10103 1010510110 10114 and 10115    111594   7808 adult massage establishment in addition to the general requirements for an adult use establishment contained in section 10226 an adult massage establishment shall regardless of whether it is licensed observe the following special requirements 1 any person making application for an adult massage establishment license shall present to the department of planning and development a state license issued pursuant to fs ch 480 after the department of planning and development has approved the application and at the time a license is to be issued no license shall be issued if the applicant fails to present the state license 2 dressing rooms shall be proportioned to the maximum number of persons who are expected to be in them at one time excluding attendants and assistants and separate dressing rooms shall be provided for men and women floors shall be of a smooth impervious material with a nonslip surface and shall be covered at the wall junction for a thorough cleaning partition walls shall terminate at least six inches above the floor or be placed on continuous raised masonry or concrete bases at least four inches high 3 one shower shall be provided for each 40 men or women or fraction thereof based upon the maximum number of persons who are expected to be using shower facilities at one time and separate shower facilities shall be provided for men and women floors and partition walls shall be constructed as required in subsection 2 of this section for dressing rooms and duck boards or wooden gratings may be used on shower floors if duplicate sets are provided and rotated in use 4 one locker shall be provided for each patron who is to be expected on the licensed premises at one time which locker shall be of sufficient size to hold clothing and other articles of wearing apparel each locker shall be capable of being locked by the patron with no one else having the key so long as the patron is using the locker or the locker shall be under the constant attention and supervision of an attendant 5 massage of a person by another person who displays or exhibits specified anatomical areas is prohibited 6 no person shall massage the genitals of another person 7 no employee as defined in this article shall engage in specified sexual activities on the licensed premises in the presence of patrons or spectators or for any form of consideration    111594 adult theater in addition to the general requirements for an adult use establishment contained in section 10226 and the special requirements of section 10232 an adult theater shall regardless of whether it is licensed observe the following special requirements 1 hall or auditorium if the adult theater contains a hall or auditorium area the area shall comply with each of the following a the theater shall have individual separate seats not couches benches or the like to accommodate the maximum number of persons who may occupy the area b the theater shall have a continuous main aisle alongside of the seating areas in order that each person seated in the areas shall be visible from the aisle at all times c the theater shall have a sign posted in a conspicuous place at or near each entranceway to the hall or auditorium area which lists the maximum number of persons who may occupy the hall or auditorium area which number shall not exceed the number of seats within the hall or auditorium area d the theater shall have one or more managers stations no one managers station can exceed 32 square feet of floor area the interior of the premises shall be configured in such a manner that there is an unobstructed view from a managers station of every area of the premises to which any patron is permitted access for any purpose excluding restrooms adult material shall not be available or allowed in restrooms if the premises has two or more managers stations designated the interior of the premises shall be configured in such a manner that there is an unobstructed view of each area of the premises to which any patron is permitted access for any purpose from at least one of the managers stations the view required in this subsection must be by direct line of sight from the managers station e it shall be the duty of the licensee the owner and the operator and it shall also be the duty of any agents and employees present in the premises to ensure that the view area specified in subsection 1d of this section remains unobstructed by any doors walls merchandise display racks or other materials at all times that any patron is present in the premises and to ensure that no patron is permitted access to any area on the premises which has been designated as an area in which patrons will not be permitted in the application filed pursuant to section 10187 f it is the duty of the licensee the owner and the operator of the premises to ensure at least one employee is on duty and situated in each managers station at all times any patron is present inside the premises and the employee is continually monitoring the activities in the adult theater for violations of this article and of state law g the licensee of an adult theater may seek a variance from subsections 1d 1e and 1f of this section if upon presentation at a public hearing the appropriate board of authority is satisfied that the licensee has proposed operational procedures sufficient to guarantee to a degree similar to the provisions of those subsections that the areas of the establishment to which patrons have access are monitored for violations of this article and of state law the appropriate board of authority may condition the variance to satisfy itself that the operational procedures attendant to the variance will be followed including but not limited to recordkeeping requirements failure to follow the conditions of the variance shall result in a review by the appropriate board of authority at a public hearing with full notice and opportunity for the applicant to be heard revocation of the variance shall be justified if based on the presentation at the hearing the assurances serving as the basis for issuance of the variance are not being satisfied in proceedings under this subsection the burden of proof shall be upon the city or the applicable city department h the premises shall be equipped with overhead lighting fixtures of sufficient intensity to illuminate every place to which patrons are permitted access at an illumination of not less than one footcandle as measured at the floor level i it shall be the duty of the licensee the owner and the operator and it shall also be the duty of any agents and employees present in the premises to ensure that the illumination described in subsection 1h is maintained at all times that any patron is present in the premises 2 adult booths if the adult theater contains adult booths each adult booth shall comply with each of the following a the theater shall have a sign posted in a conspicuous place at or near the entranceway which states the maximum number of persons who may occupy the booth which number shall correlate with the number of seats in the booth b the theater shall have a permanently open entranceway not less than two feet wide or less than six feet high which entranceway shall not have any curtain rods hinges rails or the like which would allow the entranceway to be closed or partially closed by any curtain door or other partition c the theater shall have individual separate seats not couches benches or the like which correlate with the maximum number of persons who may occupy the booth d the theater shall have a continuous main aisle alongside the booth in order that each person situated in the booth shall be visible from the aisle at all times e the theater shall have except for the entranceway walls or partitions of solid construction without any holes or openings in such walls or partitions f in addition to the sanitary facilities required by section 10228 there shall be provided within or adjacent to the common corridor passageway or area in adult motion picture theaters having adult motion picture booths adequate lavatories equipped with running water handcleansing soap or detergent and sanitary towels or handdrying devices  common towels are prohibited g if the adult theater is designed to permit outdoor viewing by persons seated in automobiles it shall have the motion picture screen so situated or the perimeter of the establishment so fenced that the material to be seen by those persons shall not be seen from any public rightofway residential zoned property mixed use zoning district church school child care facility or public recreation area 3 refurbishing of adult theaters a each adult theater shall cover the floors of areas accessible to patrons with smooth and nonpermeable flooring material which can withstand frequent effective cleaning with industrial strength cleaning agents carpeting of any type is prohibited b each adult theater shall use smooth and nonpermeable upholstery material which can withstand frequent cleaning with industrial strength cleaning agents c each adult theater shall have in areas accessible to patrons interior wall surfaces which can withstand frequent cleaning with industrial strength cleaning agents d each adult theater shall use only those shades blinds and vertical blinds which can withstand frequent cleaning with industrial strength cleaning agents draperies are prohibited 4 simulating sexual activity persons engaged in displaying or exposing specified anatomical areas are prohibited from simulating sexual activity with any patron spectator employee or other person on the premises of an adult entertainment establishment as described in section 10232    111594 special cabarets and adult theaters in addition to the general requirements for an adult use establishment contained in section 10226 any person participating in any live act demonstration exhibition or performance including but not limited to a special cabaret an adult dancing establishment an adult photographic or modeling studio and an adult theater regardless of whether it is licensed shall observe the following special requirements 1 a stage shall be provided for the display or exposure of any specified anatomical area by an employee to a person other than another employee consisting of a permanent platform or other similar permanent structure raised a minimum of 18 inches above the surrounding floor and encompassing an area of at least 100 square feet 2 the stage shall be at least three feet from the nearest patron spectator table chair or other accommodation where food or drink is served or consumed except that any establishment regulated by section 10233 shall require the person to be positioned in an entertainment area consisting of a platform or other structure raised 18 inches above the immediately surrounding area and encompassing an area of at least 100 square feet or while the person is positioned at least three feet from a patron spectator table or other accommodations 3 no person spectator or patron shall be present in the entertainment area defined in subsections 1 and 2 of this section during the course of any performance involving the display or exhibition of specified anatomical areas 4 any area in which a private performance occurs shall have a a permanently open entranceway not less that two feet wide and not less than six feet high which entranceway shall not have any curtain rods hinges rails or the like which would allow the entranceway to be closed or partially closed by any curtain door or other partition  and b walltowall floortoceiling partition of solid construction without any holes or openings which partition shall be completely or partially transparent and which partition separates the employee from the person viewing the display 5 nothing contained in this section pertaining to adult entertainment establishments as described in this section shall be construed to permit or authorize any acts or activities that are prohibited by state law    111594 exhibit or display of certain anatomical areas by employees or patrons it shall be unlawful for any employee of a commercial establishment regardless of whether it is licensed under this article where the employee knows or should have known that alcoholic beverages are on the premises to exhibit or display any area as described as a specified anatomical area as defined in section 1026    111594 operation of adult use without valid adult use license prohibited a this section shall not apply to employees engaged exclusively in performing janitorial or maintenance services this section shall be independent of and in addition to any permit or license requirements that may be imposed on employees pursuant to any federal state or local statute law or regulation b it shall be a violation of this article for any business entity or licensee to operate or for any person to be an operator or employee of an adult use establishment where the business entity licensee or person knows or should know 1 the establishment does not have an adult use permit or adult use license for any applicable classification  2 the adult use establishment has a license which is under suspension  3 the adult use establishment has a license which has been revoked  or 4 the adult establishment has a license which has expired or been cancelled    111594 prohibited adult use operations a it shall be a violation of this article for any business entity or licensee to operate or for any individual to be an operator or employee of an adult entertainment establishment unless such business shall have a currently valid license therefor under this article which license shall not be under suspension or permanently or conditionally revoked the unlawful operation of an adult entertainment establishment shall constitute a nuisance b it shall be a violation of this article for any business entity or licensee to operate or for any person to be an operator or employee of an adult theater which does not satisfy all of the special requirements of sections 10231 and 10232 of this article c it shall be a violation of this article for any business entity or licensee to operate or for any person to be an operator of or employee of an adult cabaret or adult theater which does not satisfy all of the special requirements of section 10232 d it shall be a violation of this article for any business entity or licensee to operate or for any person to be an operator or employee of an adult use establishment and to knowingly or with reason to know permit suffer or allow the entrance or exit of the adult use establishment to be locked when a person other than an employee is inside the establishment    111594 allowing employees to engage in prohibited acts a it shall be a violation of this article for any business entity licensee or any operator of an adult use establishment regardless of whether licensed under this article knowingly or with reason to know to permit suffer or allow 1 any employee or any other person to engage in any specified sexual activity at any business establishment including an adult entertainment establishment  2 any employee to display or expose any specified anatomical area at an adult entertainment establishment unless such employee is continuously positioned in an area as described in subsections 102321 and 2 and where applicable 102324  3 any employee or any other person to display or expose any specified anatomical area while simulating any specified sexual activity with any other person at the adult entertainment establishment including with another employee  4 any employee to engage in a private performance unless such employee is in an area which complies with the special requirements of subsections 102324a and 4b  5 any employee to while engaged in the display or exposure of any specified anatomical area intentionally touch any person except another employee at the adult entertainment establishment excluding for purposes of passing a gratuity that part of the persons arm distal to the wrist commonly referred to as the hand provided the employee remains at a distance of at least two feet from the person  6 any employee or any other person to touch intentionally the clothed or unclothed specified anatomical areas of any person at the entertainment establishment excluding another employee whether said person be a male or a female  7 any employee intentionally to straddle dance on under or over any part of the body of a person other than another employee at the adult entertainment establishment regardless of whether there is a touch or touching by the employee of the person for whom the employee is engaged in a straddle dance 8 any employee to while the employee is engaged in the display or exposure of any specified anatomical areas voluntarily be within three feet of any person other than an employee except for purposes of passing a gratuity in the manner as specified in paragraph 102365 set forth above b notwithstanding any provisions to the contrary contained in this it shall not be unlawful for any person or employee of a commercial establishment or an adult entertainment establishment to expose specified anatomical areas in connection with the use of approved sanitary facilities commonly known as restrooms however specified anatomical areas shall be
