shall accrue benefits as provided in this section 66339 the provision of this section shall not apply to members who have retired separated from service with the city with the right to a deferred vested benefit entered drop or attained normal retirement eligibility prior to  b benefit amounts and eligibility 1 normal retirement age and date for members who terminate employment prior to the effective date of this ordinance a members normal retirement age is the earlier of the attainment of age 55 and completion of ten years of credited service the attainment of age 52 and 25 years of credited service or 30 years of credited service regardless of age provided a member with ten or more years of credited service on  shall be eligible for normal retirement at age 55 or upon completion of 25 years of credited service regardless of age for members who terminate employment on or after the effective date of this ordinance who had completed less than ten years of credited service on  a members normal retirement age is the earlier of the attainment of age 55 and completion of ten years of credited service age 52 and completion of 25 years of credited service or the completion of 30 years of credited service regardless of age for members who terminate employment on or after the effective date of this ordinance with ten or more years of credited service on  shall be eligible for normal retirement at age 55 or upon completion of 25 years of credited service regardless of age each member shall become 100 percent vested in his accrued benefit at normal retirement age a members normal retirement date shall be the first day of the month coincident with or next following the date the member retires from the city after attaining normal retirement age 2 normal retirement benefit a member retiring on or after the normal retirement date shall receive a monthly benefit which shall commence on the first day of the month coincident with or next following his retirement and which shall be continued thereafter during the members lifetime ceasing upon death but with 120 monthly payments guaranteed in any event for members who terminate employment prior to the effective date of this ordinance the monthly retirement benefit shall equal 125 percent of average final compensation for each year of credited service earned on or after  up to a maximum of 75 percent of average final compensation provided if a members accrued benefit as of  is 75 percent or more of average final compensation the benefit percentage may not be reduced for members who terminate employment on or after the effective date of this ordinance the monthly retirement benefit shall equal 34 percent of average final compensation for each year of credited service earned on or after  up to a maximum of 100 percent of average final compensation 3 no early retirement a member may not receive an immediate or deferred retirement benefit under this section prior to attaining his or her normal retirement date as defined in this section except as provided for in subsection 66326c and subsection 66326d c cola members accruing benefits under this section shall not be entitled to a cost of living adjustment except as provided for in subsection 66326e d vesting if a member terminates employment either voluntarily or by lawful discharge the member shall be entitled to the following 1 with less than ten years of credited service including credited service earned prior to  a member is entitled to a refund of member contributions without interest 2 with ten or more years of credited service including credited service earned prior to  a member is entitled to either a the pension benefit accrued to the members date of termination based on the terms of the plan in effect on such date of termination payable commencing at the members otherwise normal retirement date provided the member does not elect to withdraw his or her member contributions  or b refund of member contributions without interest e drop no member may enter the drop on or after  members already participating in drop on  may complete their drop participation provided members who are employed on  and have attained age 55 or 25 years of credited service on that date shall be eligible to enter and participate in the drop on or after   122712   101017   supplemental benefit component for special benefits  chapter 175 share accounts there is hereby established an additional plan component to provide special benefits in the form of a supplemental retirement termination death and disability benefits to be in addition to the benefits provided for in the previous sections of this plan such benefit to be funded solely and entirely by fs ch 175 premium tax monies for each plan year which are allocated to this supplemental component as provided for in fs   amounts allocated to this supplemental component share plan shall be further allocated to the members and drop participants in a manner to be agreed upon  101017   reemployment after retirement a any retiree under this system may be reemployed by any public or private employer and may receive compensation from that employment without limiting or restricting in any way the retirement benefits payable under this system notwithstanding the previous sentence reemployment by the city shall be subject to the limitations set forth in this section b after normal retirement any retiree who is retired under normal retirement pursuant to this system and who is reemployed as a firefighter and by virtue of that reemployment is eligible to participate in this system shall upon being reemployed discontinue receipt of benefits upon reemployment the member shall be deemed to be fully vested and the additional credited service accrued during the subsequent employment period shall be used in computing a second benefit amount attributable to the subsequent employment period which benefit amount shall be added to the benefit determined upon the initial retirement to determine the total benefit payable upon final retirement calculations of benefits upon retirement shall be based upon the benefit accrual rate average final compensation and credited service as of that date and the retirement benefit amount for any subsequent employment period shall be based upon the benefit accrual rate average final compensation based only on the subsequent employment period and not including any period of drop participation and credited service as of the date of subsequent retirement the amount of any death or disability benefit received during a subsequent period of employment shall be reduced by the amount of accrued benefit eligible to be paid for a prior period of employment the optional form of benefit and any joint pensioner selected upon initial retirement shall not be subject to change upon subsequent retirement except as otherwise provided herein but the retiree may select a different optional form and joint pensioner applicable only to the subsequent retirement benefit c any retiree who is retired under normal retirement pursuant to this system who is reemployed by the city in a position other than as a firefighter shall upon being reemployed continue receipt of benefits for the period of any subsequent employment period former drop participants shall begin receipt of benefits under these circumstances d after early retirement any retiree who is retired under early retirement pursuant to this system and who subsequently becomes an employee of the city in any capacity shall discontinue receipt of benefits from the system if the reemployed person by virtue of his reemployment is eligible to participate in this system that person shall accrue a second benefit as provided for in subsection 2 above and benefit payments shall remain suspended during any such subsequent employment period if the reemployed person is not eligible to participate in this system that persons pension benefit payments shall be suspended until the earlier of termination of employment or such time as the reemployed retiree reaches the date that he would have been eligible for normal retirement under this system had he continued employment and not elected early retirement normal retirement as used in this subsection shall be the current normal retirement date provided for under this system e after disability retirement 1 subject to paragraph 2 below any retiree who is retired under section 66328 disability disability retiree may subject to subsection e physical examination requirement of that section be reemployed by any public or private employer and may receive compensation from that employment without limiting or restricting in any way the retirement benefits payable under this system 2 any disability retiree who subsequently becomes an employee of the city in any capacity except as a firefighter shall discontinue receipt of disability benefits from the system for the period of any such employment 3 if a disability retiree is reemployed as a firefighter for the city his disability benefit shall cease and section 66328 subsection e shall apply f reemployment of terminated vested persons reemployed terminated vested persons shall not be subject to the provisions of this section until such time as they begin to actually receive benefits upon receipt of benefits terminated vested persons shall be treated as normal or early retirees for purposes of applying the provisions of this section and their status as an early or normal retiree shall be determined by the date they elect to begin to receive their benefit g drop participants retirees who were in the deferred retirement option plan shall following termination of employment after drop participation have the options provided for in this section for reemployment  72319 solid waste footnotes  1  cross reference distribution of handbills restricted  461  nuisances  4631 et seq  junked wrecked and abandoned property  4696 et seq  utilities ch 86  concurrency management system ch 102 state law reference municipal home rule powers act fs ch 166  florida litter law of 197 fs   article i  in general definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning construction and demolition debris means for purposes of this article construction and demolition debris has the dame meaning as assigned to that term in 27 fac dumpster means a garbage trash or other waste material container that is mechanically lifted on to a refuse truck the term dumpster shall include compactors and rolloffs garbage means refuse tin cans glass paper bottles and the boxes and paper coming from or being disposed of by residents and commercial or business establishments and all refuse kitchen accumulation of animal fruit or vegetable matter liquid or other that attends the preparation use cooking dealing in or storing of meat fish fowl fruit or vegetables and other refuse that may accumulate in the normal household which shall all be contained in receptacles specifically provided for that purpose the term shall also include all boxes and containers provided such boxes and containers shall be broken down flat garbage can means a galvanized iron or other standard metal or plastic can and cover to fit of the type commonly sold as a garbage can of not less than five nor more than 20 gallons in capacity or other acceptable container  such receptacle to have two handles upon the sides thereof or a suitable bale by which it may be readily lifted for the purposes of easily emptying the can in a garbage pickup truck  and the metal cover of which shall be tightfitting and kept in place on the can for the purpose of preventing stenches or other nuisance multiple dwellings means all places of abode other than singlefamily residences such as apartment houses roominghouses and boardinghouses sanitariums rest homes hospitals resident schools hotels motels and motor courts guesthouses tourist homes trailer courts trailer camps and all other similar places noncombustible refuse or words of similar connotation mean refuse materials that are unburnable at ordinary bonfire or incinerator temperatures such as durable junk metals mineral matter stone cement and concrete derivatives glass crockery metal furniture or parts thereof vehicle bodies or parts thereof and other similar material or refuse none of which shall be placed in garbage containers or in any way mixed with garbage temporary construction rolloff container means a dumpster used on a temporary construction site or a special event trash means any refuse other than garbage or putrescible material this shall include discarded paper discarded flower decorations cuttings of grass and weeds and branches and vines provided such branches shrubs and vines are placed in containers or bundles not to exceed 40 pounds in weight or four feet in length the term trash does not include earth trees tree trunks limbs over three inches in diameter wallpaper roofing material plaster concrete or other substances that may accumulate as a result of repairs to land or buildings or as a result of initial clearing of lots or as a result of building operations for practical purposes unless otherwise prohibited and where not unduly cumbersome for ordinary pickup and disposal purposes trash may include noncombustible as well as combustible refuse unless and until trash shall be disposed of by incinerator method    8     2591   51308 cross reference definitions generally  12 treatment of garbage matter specified a all garbage tin cans bottles and other disposable containers shall first be drained of liquids and shall be deposited at least once daily in garbage cans required in section 7036 b the wet garbage matter shall be drained and wrapped in paper before being placed in a garbage can  provided however hotels restaurants or other eating establishments upon an exemption granted by the city shall not be required to wrap wet garbage and provided further all such excepted persons shall clean and rinse and maintain in a reasonably sanitary and nonodorous condition each garbage can immediately following each collection of garbage and shall at all times maintain the can free from stench or other nuisance which shall be done in such way as not to commit a public or private nuisance      accumulation of garbage and insufficient number of cans it shall be unlawful for the owner or occupant or manager or person responsible for any land or premises to permit suffer or allow either by commission or omission any accumulation of garbage or other waste material upon premises or property within the city for a period longer than four days without having arranged for disposal of the accumulation by some person qualified under this chapter to perform such services or by the duly authorized garbage collector of the city it shall be unlawful for any person whether owner manager or occupant of any premises to fail to provide a sufficient number of containers per unit as provided in this chapter to amply provide for any fourday period of garbage or other noxious wastes      removal of industrial waste by owner industrial wastes and other noncombustible refuse must be removed by the owner occupant or operator or by a duly licensed contractor at the users expense      burning no garbage refuse trash or other discarded matter shall be burned in an incinerator furnace or other similar incinerating device or directly upon real property within the corporate limits        burial it shall be unlawful for any person to bury garbage trash or any other unwholesome matter      transportation of garbage unless specifically authorized by resolution of the city commission it shall be unlawful for any person to transport garbage over the public streets or alleys except for the purpose of having the garbage picked up by persons authorized by the city to pick up and dispose of the garbage      littering  placement in cans of another it shall be unlawful for any person to deposit garbage refuse trash or other discarded matter upon the premises of another or upon any street alley parkway or other public or private property or into any drain canal ditch waterway gulf bay rockbed sandbed pool pond or the like within the city or in the can or receptacle of another who has paid the collection service fee as provided in this chapter however tenants of multiple dwellings or businesses where authorized may deposit garbage in cans which shall be authorized for the use of such tenants by the owner or manager thereof        prevention of accumulations in order to prevent any overflow of garbage trash noncombustible refuse or any other waste material the city shall be entitled to require that either the size of the garbage can or dumpster be increased or that pickup service be increased or both at the expense of the property owner or property occupant    2591 secs 70107035  reserved article ii  containers footnotes  2  cross reference garbage cans and dumpsters  1341296 et seq required  exemptions  covers  placement for collection a all owners or residents or occupants of singlefamily dwellings twofamily dwellings multiplefamily dwellings businesses and commercial establishments or enterprises within the city shall provide either garbage cans or dumpsters of sufficient capacity to hold garbage and trash which has accumulated between service pickup days b each cooking unit of a singlefamily dwelling twofamily dwelling or a multiplefamily dwelling shall have either garbage cans or dumpsters adequate and sufficient in size to hold garbage trash noncombustible refuse and other waste materials which have accumulated between service pickup days as provided in subsection a of this section garbage cans and dumpsters whether for residential dwellings twofamily dwellings multiplefamily dwellings businesses or commercial enterprises or establishments shall be placed in one location on the premises for collection purposes which location shall be approved by the city c garbage cans and dumpsters shall be kept tightly covered at all times except when it is necessary to lift the cover for disposal or removal of garbage trash noncombustible refuse or other waste materials or to deposit such therein it shall be unlawful for any person to deposit garbage trash noncombustible refuse or other waste materials in such amounts in the can or dumpster that will not permit the cover to be kept tightly in place temporary construction rolloff containers shall be exempt from the requirements of this subsection but shall be required to comply with all other requirements of this chapter d residential garbage can customers may not deposit cans at the curb other than the night before their scheduled pickup and the cans must be removed by nightfall the same day of the scheduled pickup e dumpster screening gates shall be open in a position suitable for pickup of front loader service f horticultural trimmings placed at curbside in accordance with other city ordinances and regulations shall be exempt from this section  103   11     2591 sanitation garbage cans and dumpsters shall be kept aboveground in places easily accessible to the city inspector and to the employees of the garbage collector garbage cans and dumpsters shall not be kept in such places or under such conditions as to cause an unnecessary or unreasonable offense to sightliness cleanliness safety or other sanitary conditions garbage cans shall not be kept upon neighboring property not in ownership or tenancy of the person by whom the garbage was accumulated whether such neighboring property is vacant or improved without the written consent of the person having the right to grant such consent this section is subject to the regulations contained in section 1341296 et seq        2591 inspection  condemnation all garbage cans and dumpsters shall be subject to an inspection and approval or condemnation by the city inspector or police department at all times upon condemnation by the city inspector or police of any garbage can or dumpster a notice of such condemnation shall be placed upon the condemned can or handed to the owner or occupant or left at his regular place of abode and he shall comply therewith it shall be unlawful for any person to place in such condemned can or dumpster any garbage or other material and the owner or occupant of the premises shall forthwith provide a new can or dumpster to take the place of the can or dumpster condemned        2591 construction and demolition debris collection all temporary construction roll off containers for sites within the city that contain construction and demolition debris shall be provided by a construction and demolition debris collection andor recycling provider authorized by the city  51308 secs 70407065  reserved article iii  collection service footnotes  3  state law reference florida resources recovery and management act fs   et seq division 1  generally city to provide  use required a the city shall provide garbage and trash collection services reasonably adequate and sufficient to take care of the reasonable disposal needs of all properties within the city limits either by establishing and operating its own garbage and trash collection and disposal facilities or by contracting or subcontracting with a private contractor b all residents occupants or owners of premises in the city are required to have all accumulations of garbage removed and disposed of by such garbage collection services   a 25b     1396 city managers duties the office of the city manager shall do whatsoever is necessary and proper in the organization operation billing collections and all other things incident to the garbage and trash collection and disposal services   i       collection schedule for transient users other special temporary or transient users of the solid waste collection system such as circuses tent shows carnivals or other miscellaneous or transient users shall pay such fee for garbage and trash collection services as determined by the city commission either by ordinance or franchise agreement   k   secs 70697095  reserved division 2  rates and charges footnotes  4  editors note rates are also provided for in a contract or agreement between the city and a private garbage collection company payment required it is mandatory for all improved properties within the city unless specifically exempted to pay the prescribed fees and charges for garbage and trash collection service the owner of each unit of improved real estate within the city and all persons utilizing garbage and trash collection services shall pay the fee for such collection services as billed  1032  b d     basis a generally the city shall determine from time to time the reasonable cost of garbage collection and disposal services and shall by appropriate ordinance or franchise agreement assess and impose a unit cost against the owner user or occupant of every improved property within the city which rate for the collection and disposal services furnished or available shall be equivalent and uniform according to a schedule of rate per unit or for other type of classified user having need for garbage and trash collection and disposal services b overhead expenses the city commission in computing the charge per unit against the users of garbage and trash collection service shall take into consideration the administrative and servicing charges incident to billing and collecting accounts making payments to the garbage collector and any other incidental or legitimate charges as may be sufficient to pay for the entire garbage collection services c type and amount of service the charge for such services shall be based upon the type and amount of garbage and trash collections the number of containers per week and the frequency in schedule of collections as the city commission shall from time to time determine and provide by ordinance or franchise agreement appropriate discounts for advance payment of the required service fees may be provided by appropriate ordinance  1030   25a c       changes or modifications a nothing shall prevent the city commission from time to time from modifying or changing the type or schedule of garbage and trash collection service so long as reasonably adequate service is provided to take care of the minimum needs of the people of the city b nothing contained in this chapter shall prevent the city commission from time to time in the light of experience and in accordance with its contractual or other costs including administrative and other incidental costs to modify the charge per unit for garbage and trash collection services rendered by the city for the people of the city provided that such shall be done by ordinance or franchise agreement adopted by the city commission   f   collection procedures and remedies a if a customer fails to pay the amount due to the city under this division the city may enforce collection of the rate by imposing a lien on the real property involved by filing a civil action against the customer for the amount due to the city by ceasing further garbage and trash or refuse collection service or by all of such remedies b all property within the city is subject to lien for nonpayment of the garbage and trash collection service charges in addition to any other penalties prescribed in this chapter if the owner of any improved property subject to payment of collection service charges fails to pay such charges on or before the final date set by the city for payment or fails to pay charges in advance when the service is commenced during the year the city may impose a lien upon the property of such owner the amount of such lien shall be based upon the total service charge due plus eight percent interest plus all costs including reasonable attorneys fee incident to filing and imposing the lien such lien shall be imposed against the land and may be enforced and the property sold to satisfy such lien in the manner prescribed by law c in addition to any other penalty prescribed by this chapter if the owner of any improved property subject to payment of garbage and trash charges fails to pay the amount due within 60 days from the original date of billing the city shall assess a penalty equivalent to one percent a month on the unpaid bill plus $500 1d 1033           2     state law reference enforcement of statutory liens fs ch 85  foreclosure of municipal tax and special assessment liens fs ch 173 secs unlawful conduct it shall be unlawful for any person to in any way obstruct the streets alleys sidewalks or other public passageways of the city except as authorized by the building code as adopted in section 9826 and amended by the city or by ordinance  provided however that alleyways in passagrille south of 32nd avenue that have a platted width of 15 feet or greater may have planted landscaping that reduces the width of the clear travel path to no less than 12 feet with equal portions of landscaping on each side of the alley with an approved rightofway use permit issued by the city manager such landscaping shall not block access to any driveway and shall not reduce the visibility triangles required by division 6 of the land development regulations the city reserves the right to trim or remove any such landscaping at its discretion with or without notice for any reason related to the health safety or welfare of the community without compensation to any adjacent property owner      92109 goods boxes benches along sidewalks and streets  permit a it shall be unlawful for any person or the agent or representative of any person to place put or leave any goods wares merchandise boxes benches or other obstructions of any nature whatsoever on any of the sidewalks along the streets of the city outside the property line of the streets b benches or seats for occupancy by persons may be placed and maintained on and along the sidewalks provided they are maintained by the owner or occupant of the abutting property in a safe and sightly condition and no part thereof extends more than 24 inches outside of and beyond the property line of such owner c goods and merchandise delivered to duly licensed merchants and operators of places of business may be deposited and left on the sidewalks immediately in front of the places of business of such merchants and operators between the hours of  midnight and  am of the next morning if any such place of business is not then open or has no storage area to receive such goods and merchandise at time of delivery the leaving of any goods or merchandise on the sidewalks after  am of the morning of delivery shall be and constitute a violation of this section by the merchant or operator of the place of business to whom such delivery is made d any person may apply to the city manager for a permit which would allow an exemption from this section the application shall be made in sufficient time to enable the city manager to investigate such facts as he deems appropriate in order to reach a determination as to whether or not to issue the requested permit the permit shall be subject to the following 1 the city manager may attach such conditions to the permit as deemed appropriate and the permit holder shall comply with all such conditions 2 any permit issued by the city manager shall only be valid for the date time or place specifically set forth in the permit 3 the issuance of a permit shall be within the discretion of the city manager and the granting of a permit in one instance shall not be construed as precedence for the issuance of any other permit even if such conditions are identical to those for which a permit has previously been issued 4 the city manager may without notice terminate a permit if the holder thereof does not comply with any of the conditions of such permit or if the holder thereof is in violation of any of the laws of the state or the ordinances of the city        3585 sidewalk sale permits a notwithstanding any of the sections of this chapter the city manager shall have authority to issue a permit which would allow the holder thereof to conduct a sidewalk sale under the terms and conditions set forth in the permit b the procedure for the application for the granting of the permit shall be as follows 1 the applicant shall notify the city manager or his designee in writing of his intent to apply for a permit granting a sidewalk sale 2 the applicant shall submit to the city manager such information as the city manager deems appropriate in order to assist him in making a decision as to whether or not to grant or deny the application c if the application has been granted a written permit shall be issued the permit may be in any form determined appropriate by the city manager d permits for sidewalk sales when issued by the city manager shall only be valid for the date and time and place specifically set forth in the permit the issuance of a permit for a sidewalk sale shall be within the discretion of the city manager and the granting of a permit in one instance shall not be construed as precedence for the granting of a permit in any other instance    3585 cross reference special event permits  2631 et seq secs 74347460  reserved division 2  newspaper racks definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alley means a minor rightofway providing secondary vehicular access to the side or rear of properties otherwise abutting on a street distributor means the person or any other legal entity owning or responsible for placing or maintaining a newspaper box or vending machine in a public rightofway newspaper rack means any selfservice or coinoperated box container storage unit vending machine or other dispenser installed used or maintained for the display sale or distribution of newspapers or other news periodicals or advertising circulars the term newspaper rack shall include the term newspaper box or newspaper vending machine public property means any park cemetery school yard open space adjacent thereto all waterways and sovereign lands as designated by the state or the united states government or the city recovery area means that space as determined by the state department of transportation specifications which is measured from the edge of the roadway outward and which is required to clear of fixed objects rightofway means all lands conveyed or dedicated to the public to be used for a street alley walkway drainage facility or other public purpose roadway means that portion of a street unimproved designed or ordinarily used for vehicular travel including a median street means that portion of a street improved designed or ordinarily used for vehicular travel including a median walkway means a rightofway intended primarily for use by pedestrians including selfpropelled vehicles b   51893 cross reference definitions generally  12  businesses ch 26 purpose and criteria the purpose and criteria of the following is to promote the public health safety and welfare of location installation appearance and servicing of newspaper racks on public rightsofway so as to 1 provide for pedestrian handicap and driving safety and convenience 2 provide for free and unobstructed passage along the sidewalks of the city 3 restrict unreasonable interference with the flow of pedestrians including disabled persons or vehicular traffic including ingress or egress from any residence or place of business or from the street to the sidewalk by persons exiting or entering parked or standing vehicles 4 reduce unnecessary exposure of the public to personal injury or property damage 5 provide for public and property safety during high winds associated with storms and hurricane conditions 6 provide reasonable access for the use and maintenance of poles posts traffic signs or signals hydrants mailboxes and access to locations used for public transportation purposes 7 relocate and replace newspaper racks which result in a visual blight and excessive space allocation on the public rightofway or which detract from the aesthetics of the character of the neighborhood 8 treat all newspapers equally regardless of size content circulation or frequency of publication 9 maintain and preserve freedom of the press 10 cooperate to the maximum with newspaper distributors a   51893 enforcement a upon determination by the director of community services or his designee that a newspaper rack has been installed used or maintained in violation of this division an order to correct the offending conditions shall be issued to the distributor of the newspaper rack such order shall be mailed by certified mail return receipt requested to the address required by subsection 7464a the order shall specifically describe the offending condition suggest action necessary to correct the condition and advise of removal pursuant to subsection b of this section b failure to promptly correct the offending condition within ten days after receipt of the order shall result in the offending newspaper rack being removed by the city when the distributor of the offending newspaper rack is not known or identified as required by this section a copy of the order shall be posted on the newspaper rack and this shall be deemed sufficient notice c any distributor aggrieved by a decision to remove or by the removal of a newspaper rack shall upon written request be entitled to a hearing before the city manager or his designee at which time the distributor may show why the newspaper rack complies with this division or why compliance should not be required if the distributor appeals the order to the city manager or his designee removal of the newspaper rack shall be stayed pending final disposition of the appeal d any newspaper rack removed from the public rightofway shall be stored at the cost of the distributor the city shall be reimbursed by the distributor for all costs incurred in the removal and storage of all newspaper racks removed from the public rightofway by the city within three days after the removal of any newspaper rack from the public rightofway the city shall send the distributor of the newspaper rack by certified mail return receipt requested notice of removal the city is authorized to sell the newspaper rack at a public sale if the newspaper rack is not claimed by the distributor within a period of 60 days from the date of removal seven days prior to sale the city shall advertise notice of the sale in a daily newspaper of general circulation in the city all unpaid removal and storage costs and advertisement costs shall be paid out of the proceeds of the sale of the newspaper racks the remaining balance of the sale proceeds shall become the property of the city and shall be transferred to the citys general fund f   51893 identification and registration a each newspaper rack shall have affixed to it in a readily visible place the telephone number of a working telephone service to call to report a malfunction or to secure a refund if the coinreturn mechanism malfunctions and shall also provide the name and address of the distributor to receive the notices provided for in this division b although no permit or license is required prior to the placement of newspaper racks any person who places or maintains such a newspaper rack shall notify the director or community services or his designee of the location or of a change in location d   51893 standards all newspaper racks maintained or operated within a public rightofway or other public property shall conform to the following standards 1 no newspaper rack shall be placed on a roadway newspaper racks shall be placed on that portion of the sidewalk farthest away from the edge of a street or curb in conformance with subsection 10 of this and other applicable sections of this division 2 no newspaper rack shall be allowed at any location whereby the clear space for the passage of pedestrians persons in handicap devices or bicycle riders is reduced to less than five feet pursuant to subsection 10f of this section 3 no newspaper rack shall be placed at any site or location when the installation use or maintenance a endangers the safety of persons or property  b unreasonably interferes with or impedes the flow of pedestrians persons in handicap or disabled person devices or vehicular traffic including any legally parked or stopped vehicle  or c unreasonably interferes with the use of traffic signs or signals hydrants or mailboxes permitted at or near the location 4 no newspaper rack shall exceed 36 inches in height 30 inches in width or 20 inches in depth 5 no newspaper rack shall be chained bolted or otherwise attached to any property or to any permanently fixed object not owned by the distributor of the newspaper rack businessrequired no persons shall engage in or carry out the business of massage unless he has a valid massage business permit issued by the city pursuant to the provisions of this chapter for each and every separate office or place of business conducted by such person ch 4  803  a 8191982 sameapplication any person desiring a massage business permit shall file a written application with the chief of police and city secretary on a form to be furnished by the city secretary the applicant shall accompany the application with a tender of the correct permit fee as hereinafter provided and shall in addition furnish the following 1 the type of ownership of the business ie whether individual partnership corporation or otherwise  2 the name style and designation under which the business or practice is to be conducted  3 the business address and all telephone numbers where the business is to be conducted  4 a complete list of the names and residence addresses of all masseurs and employees in the business and the name and residence addresses of the manager or other person principally in charge of the operation of the business  5 the following personal information concerning the applicant if an individual  and concerning each stockholder holding more than ten percent of the stock of the corporation each officer and each director if the applicant is a corporation and concerning the partners including limited partners if the applicant is a partnership  and the holder of any lien of any nature upon the business andor the equipment used therein  and concerning the manager or other person principally in charge of the operation of the business a name complete residence address and telephone numbers  b the two previous addresses immediately prior to the present address of the applicant  c written proof of age  d height weight color of hair and eyes and sex  e two frontface portrait photographs taken within 30 days of the date of the application and at least two inches by two inches in size  f the massage or similar business history and experience ten years prior to the date of application including but not limited to whether or not such person previously operating in this or another city or state under license or permit has had such license or permit denied revoked or suspended and the reason therefor and the business activities or occupations subsequent to such action of denial suspension or revocation  g all criminal arrests other than misdemeanor traffic violations fully disclosing the jurisdiction in which arrested and the offense for which arrested and the disposition thereof  h a complete set of fingerprints taken and to be retained on file by the chief of police or his authorized representatives  6 such other information identification and physical examination of the person as shall be deemed necessary by the police chief to discover the truth of the matters hereinbefore required to be set forth in the application  7 authorization for the city its agents and employees to seek information and conduct an investigation into the truth of the statements set forth in the application and the qualifications of the applicant for the permit  8 the names and addresses of three adult residents of the county who will serve as character references these references must be persons other than relatives and business associates  9 written declaration of the applicant under penalty of perjury that the foregoing information contained in the application is true and correct said declaration being duly dated and signed in the city ch 4  805   8191982 sameissuance the city secretary utilities ch 86 state law reference municipal public service tax fs    levied  amount a electricity  gas  water there is imposed and levied by the city on each and every purchase of electricity  metered or bottled natural liquefied petroleum or manufactured gas  and water service within the corporate limits a tax in the amount of ten percent of the payments received by the seller of the taxable item from the purchaser for the purchase of such service b telecommunications service there is levied a seven percent tax on the purchase of telecommunications service within the city which originates and terminates in this state excluding public telephone charges collected on site access charges and any customer access line charges paid to a local telephone company this tax shall be governed by fs  9bd and the applicable provisions of fs  20301 c fuel oil there is imposed and levied by the city on each and every purchase of fuel oil within the corporate limits a tax in the amount of $004 per gallon which tax shall be collected from the purchaser of such fuel oil by a purchaser to the seller at the time of the purchasers paying the charge to the seller d remittance the seller shall remit the tax to the city not less often than monthly                  101585 service within city the purchase of the utility service upon which a tax is imposed and levied by this article shall embrace and include any part of the transaction of purchase occurring with the corporate limits whether the transaction is the entering into a contract for the purchase of any such utility service or otherwise      computation of tax on aggregate purchases when the seller of fuel oil  electricity or metered or bottled natural liquefied petroleum or manufactured gas  water service  and telecommunications service collects the charge for such service at monthly periods the tax imposed and levied by this article may be computed on the aggregate amount of purchases during such monthly period provided the amount of the tax to be collected shall be the nearest whole cent to the amount computed        collection by seller the seller of electricity fuel oil and metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum or manufactured water service and telecommunication service in acting as the tax collection medium or agency for the city shall collect from the purchaser for the use of the city the tax imposed and levied under this article at the time of collecting the purchase price charged for each transaction the seller shall report and pay over to the finance director on or before the 15th day of each calendar month all such taxes imposed levied and collected during the preceding calendar month it shall be unlawful for any seller of such utility service to collect the price of any sale of fuel oil electricity and metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured water service and telecommunications service without at the same time collecting the tax imposed and levied in respect to such purchase unless such seller shall elect to assume and pay such tax without collecting it from the purchaser any seller failing to collect such tax at the time of collecting the price of any purchase where the seller has not elected to assume and pay such tax shall be liable to the city for the amount of such tax in like manner as if the tax had been actually paid to the seller the city shall cause to be brought all suits and actions and to take all proceedings as may be necessary for the recovery of such tax the seller shall not be liable for the payment of such tax upon uncollected charges if any purchaser shall fail neglect or refuse to pay the tax imposed and levied and as required on account of the purchase for which such charge is made the seller shall have and is vested with the right power and authority to immediately discontinue further service to such purchaser until the tax and the sellers bill shall have been paid in full          records of seller each and every seller of electricity fuel oil and metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured water service and telecommunications service shall keep complete records showing all purchases in the city of such commodities or service which records shall show the price as charged upon each purchase the date of purchase and the date of payment and such records shall be kept open for inspection by the duly authorized agents of the city during business hours on all business days the duly authorized city agents shall have the right power and authority to make such transcripts of such records during such time as they may desire        failure to pay tax any purchaser willfully failing refusing or neglecting to pay the tax imposed and levied in this article where the seller has not elected to assume and pay such tax and any seller willfully violating this article or any officer agent or employee of the seller violating this article shall upon conviction be subject to the penalties provided by section 114      exemptions a the united states the state and the political subdivisions and authorities thereof and county and municipal governments are exempted from payment of the tax imposed and levied by this article upon the services used by such governmental agencies b recognized churches are exempt from the tax on purchases or services used exclusively for church purposes      state law reference exemptions fs   secs 78637889  reserved article iv  local business tax footnotes  4  editors note  adopted  amended art iv to read as herein collectors of solid waste  70126  vehicles for hire ch 90 state law reference local license tax fs ch 205 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning business profession and occupation do not include the customary religious charitable or educational activities of nonprofit religious nonprofit charitable and nonprofit educational institutions which institutions are more particularly defined and limited as follows 1 religious institutions means churches and ecclesiastical or denominational organizations or established physical places for worship in this state at which nonprofit religious services and activities are regularly conducted and carried on and also means church cemeteries  2 educational institutions means state taxsupported or parochial church and nonprofit private schools colleges or universities conducting regular classes and courses of study required for accreditation by or membership in the southern association of colleges and schools the department of education or the florida council of independent schools nonprofit libraries art galleries and museums open to the public are defined as educational institutions and eligible for exemption  and 3 charitable institutions means only nonprofit corporations operating physical facilities in this state at which are provided charitable services a reasonable percentage of which are without cost to those unable to pay classification means the method by which a business or group of businesses is identified by size or type or both local business tax means the fees charged and the method by which the city grants the privilege of engaging in or managing any business profession or occupation within its jurisdiction it does not mean any fees or licenses paid to any board commission or office for permits registration examination or inspection unless otherwise provided by law these are deemed to be regulatory and in addition to but not in lieu of any local business tax imposed under the provisions of this chapter person means any individual firm partnership joint adventure syndicate or other group or combination acting as a unit association corporation estate trust business trust trustee executer administrator receiver or other receipt means the document that is issued by the city which bears the words local business tax receipt and evidences that the person in whose name the document is issued has complied with the provisions of this chapter relating to the local business tax taxpayer means any person liable for taxes imposed under the provisions of this article  any agent required to file and pay taxes imposed hereunder  and the heirs successors assignees and transferees of any such person or agent  41007 levied a local business taxes in the amounts specified in section 78110 are levied on 1 any person who maintains a permanent business location or branch office within the city for the privilege of engaging in or managing any business within the city 2 any person who maintains a permanent business location or branch office within the city for the privilege of engaging in or managing any profession or occupation within the city 3 any person who does not qualify under subsection a1 or 2 of this section and who transacts any business or engages in any occupation or profession in interstate commerce if such business tax is not prohibited by section 8 of article i of the united states constitution b it shall be unlawful for any person to conduct any business upon which is levied a local business tax without first paying such tax to the city c a separate local business tax shall be levied on each branch establishment or location where a separate business is conducted provided that warehouses and distributing plants used in connection with and incidental to a business licensed under this article shall not be deemed to be separate places of business or branch establishments each rental real property shall be deemed a branch establishment or separate place of business for the purposes of this article when there is a representative of the owner or the owners agent on the premises who is authorized to transact business for such owner or owners agent or there is a regular employee of the owner or of the owners agent working on the premises a real estate broker or agent having a for rent or for sale sign on one or more premises within the city shall be deemed to be doing business within the city d a person engaged in two or more businesses at the same location shall not be required to obtain separate business tax receipts for conducting each of such businesses unless otherwise provided in this article but when eligible shall be issued one tax receipt for the highest amount payable for any one of the businesses and shall be charged a tax equal to onehalf of the tax required for each additional business such additional businesses shall be specified on the face of the receipt  41007 duties and responsibilities a the city manager shall issue business tax receipts in the name of the city to all persons qualified under this article and shall 1 promulgate and enforce all reasonable rules and regulations necessary to the operation and enforcement of this article  2 prescribe and provide all forms and information to be given therein as to character and other relevant matter for all necessary papers  3 require applicants to submit all affidavits and oaths necessary to the administration of this article  4 submit all applications in a proper case to interested city officials for their endorsements thereon as to compliance by the applicant with all city regulations which they have the duty of enforcing  5 investigate and determine the eligibility of any applicant for a local business tax receipt as prescribed in this article  6 examine the books and records of any applicant or receipt holder when reasonably necessary to the administration and enforcement of this article  and 7 notify any applicant of the acceptance or rejection of his or her application and shall upon the city managers refusal to issue any receipt at the applicants request state in writing the reasons therefor and deliver them to the applicant b when the issuance of a business tax receipt is denied and any action is instituted by the applicant to compel its issuance such applicant shall not engage in the business for which the receipt was refused unless issuance of the license is ordered by final judgment of the court  41007 inspections and reports a the city manager shall make all investigations reasonably necessary to the enforcement of this article the manager shall have the authority to order the inspection of receipt holders their businesses and premises by all city officials having duties to perform with reference to such receipt holders or businesses b the police officers shall inspect and examine businesses located within their respective jurisdictions or beats to enforce compliance with this article c the fire marshal and director of community development shall have authority to order inspections or conduct inspections under the building code the mechanical code the plumbing code the electrical code the life safety code the gas code the fire prevention code and any other codes adopted by the city d all persons authorized in this section to inspect receipt holders and businesses shall have the authority to enter with or without search warrant at all reasonable times the premises for which business tax receipt 1 is required  2 was issued and which at the time of inspection is operating under such receipt  or 3 has been revoked or suspended e persons inspecting receipt holders their businesses or premises as authorized in this section shall report all violations of all laws or ordinances to the city manager and shall submit such other report as the city manager shall order  41007 collection remedies any unpaid tax required by this article shall constitute a debt due the city the city attorney shall at the direction of the city manager institute civil suit in the name of the city to recover any such unpaid tax no civil judgment or any act by the city attorney the city manager or the violator shall bar or prevent a prosecution for each and every violation of this article  41007 refund no rebate or refund of any local business tax or part thereof shall be made because of the nonuse of the business tax receipt or because of a change of location or business rendering the use of such tax receipt ineffective a rebate or refund of the business tax may be made only if the business tax was collected proof of grounds for rebate shall be submitted to the city manager in the form of an affidavit and the decision of the city manager shall be final  41007 business tax receiptrequired no person shall engage in any business trade or profession in the city without first obtaining a business tax receipt issued by the city manager and paying the tax required pursuant to this article the issuance of a business tax receipt for a business on any premises within the city shall not constitute nor be construed as approval by the city of the land use zoning or other developmental approval of the particular business on the premises for which such receipt was issued businesses operating in association with city sponsored special events may be exempted from this requirement upon approval of the city manager  41007   51308 application procedures  proration of tax a every person required to pay a tax under this article or any section of this other city ordinance shall submit if requested or required a declaration form to the city manager the declaration form shall 1 be a written statement upon forms provided by the city manager such form shall include an affidavit to be sworn to by the applicant 2 require the disclosure of all information necessary to complete the application form if the applicant starts his business on or after april 1 of the year of application and prior to october 1 next succeeding the applicant shall be required to pay only onehalf of the annual tax and shall receive a license for the balance of the taxable year b whenever a business tax receipt cannot be issued at the time the application for the receipt is made the city manager shall issue a receipt to the applicant for the application fee in advance such receipt shall not be construed as the approval of the city manager for the issuance of a business tax receipt and it shall not entitle or authorize the applicant to open or maintain any business contrary to this article  41007 fee at the time an application is submitted an business tax receipt application fee in an amount established by resolution of the city commission and listed in appendix a to this shall be paid to the city this fee shall be nonrefundable and in addition to the business tax in section 78110 and any inspection fees  41007 business tax receipt exemption for rental of individual room in home no business tax receipt shall be required of any person where that person is renting no more than one individual room within his home where authorized under chapter 134 and such rental is not incidental to a business requiring a business tax receipt for guest accommodation  41007 issuance of business tax receipt a the city manager shall deny business tax receipt to any business whose proposed operation would violate any law or ordinance b no business tax receipt shall be issued by the city to any person required by state law to be registered and issued a certificate to practice any profession or engage in any business unless such person in applying for a receipt shall submit proof of having been duly qualified to practice the profession or engage in the business under the state law  41007 contents of receipt every business tax receipt shall state upon its face the following 1 the name and address of the receipt holder and any other name under which such business is to be conducted  2 the nature of each business for which such receipt is issued  3 the amount of the local business tax  4 the dates of issuance and expiration  and 5 such other information as the city manager shall determine  41007 posting of receipt and insignia every business tax receipt holder shall 1 post and maintain the business tax receipt upon the permitted premises in a place where it may be seen at all times  2 affix any insignia delivered for use in connection with business tax receipts on the inside glass part of the window of such establishment facing the public way or on the inside glass part of the door opening on the public way such insignia shall be placed and maintained so as to be plainly visible from the public way premises not fronting on a public way at street level or having a glass door opening upon the public way shall have the insignia displayed in the door window or other prominent place in the nearest proximity to the principal public entrance to such establishment and the insignia shall be placed and maintained so as to be plainly visible from such public entrance  3 affix any insignia delivered for use in connection with a motor vehicle for which such receipt has been issued on the windshield of the vehicle or as may be otherwise required by the city manager or by law  4 affix any metal or other durable type of insignia delivered for use in connection with a wagon or other vehicle not operated by motor power securely on the outside of such vehicle  5 carry such receipt on his or her person when he or she has no business premises  6 affix any insignia delivered for use in connection therewith upon the outside of any coinoperated vending or other business machine or device so that it may be seen at all times  and 7 not allow any business tax receipt or insignia to remain posted or displayed or used after the period for which it was issued has expired or when it has been suspended or revoked or for any other reason it becomes ineffective the receipt holder shall promptly return such ineffective receipt or insignia to the city manager  41007 expiration renewal of receipt  penalties a expiration a business tax receipt issued pursuant to this article shall expire on september 30 of each year b renewal an expired business tax receipt shall be renewable beginning august 1 of each year being due and payable on or before september 30 of each year and shall expire on september 30 of the succeeding year if september 30 falls on a weekend or holiday the tax is due and payable on or before the first working day following september 30 c penalties for late payment if the business tax has not been paid in accordance with this section a ten percent penalty shall be charged for any payment made during the month of october plus an additional five percent penalty for each subsequent month of delinquency until the tax has been paid however the total delinquency penalty shall not exceed 25 percent of the business tax due for the person or business entity required to pay such tax d failure to obtain required receipt any person engaging in or managing any business occupation or profession without first obtaining a local business tax receipt if required by this shall be subject to a penalty of 25 percent of the business tax determined to be due in addition to any other penalty provided by law or ordinance e additional penalties any person who engages in any business occupation or profession covered by this article who does not pay the required business tax within 150 days after the initial notice of tax and who does not obtain the required business tax receipt is subject to civil actions and penalties including court costs reasonable attorneys fees additional administrative costs incurred as a result of collection efforts and a monthly penalty of ten percent of the annual business tax up to 50 percent of the annual business tax or $25000 whichever is less nothing contained in this section shall prohibit the city from citing any person or business entity in violation of this subsection for each day the violation occurs or is in existence including citations made daily each such citation shall be separately made and constitute a single violation punishable as described in section 114  41007 duplicate business tax receipts a duplicate business tax receipt shall be issued by the city manager to replace any tax receipt previously issued which has been lost stolen defaced or destroyed without any willful conduct on the part of the receipt holder upon filing by the receipt holder of an affidavit sworn to before a notary public of this state attesting to such fact  41007 transferability of business tax receipt a except as may be otherwise prohibited by state law a business tax receipt holder shall have the right to transfer the receipt to another person provided he or she shall 1 provide satisfactory written evidence to the city manager that there has been a bona fide sale of business  2 execute the transfer in the manner prescribed by the city manager  3 report the completed act of transfer to the city manager within 30 days of the sale of the business  4 surrender any receipt and when required by the city manager all insignia within 30 days of sale of the business  and 5 pay a transfer fee of ten percent of the annual business tax but not less than nor more than the amounts established by resolution of the city commission and listed in appendix a to this b upon written request and presentation of the original business tax receipt any receipt may be transferred from one location to another location in the city upon payment of a transfer fee of ten percent of the annual business tax but not less than nor more than the amounts established by resolution of the city commission and listed in appendix a to this c upon the completion of a written request for transfer of a business tax receipt and compliance with this article the city manager shall issue a new receipt and insignia to the transferee for the unexpired term of the old receipt the new receipt issued under subsection a of this section shall authorize the transferee named in the new receipt to engage in the same business at the same location or at such other place as shall be approved by the city manager pursuant to subsection b of this section transfer of a business tax receipt does not exempt the transferee from complying with any and all applicable ordinances regulating the business  41007 order to cease and desist  revocation or suspension of receipt a order to cease and desist 1 when a violation of any law or ordinance has been observed by or reported to the department of community development hereinafter the department the director of the department or any of his designated officials shall issue an order to cease and desist hereinafter the order the order shall be in writing shall be personally served upon the person or entity named in the order and shall set forth the violation for which the order was issued service of the order shall be made at the address set forth on the business tax receipt and shall be directed to the person named as owner or operator of the business for which the receipt was issued if the owner of the receipt is a corporation partnership or other business entity then service shall be made upon the person holding or owning the tax receipt if the owner or operator of the business cannot be found on the premises of the business then service may be made upon any manager or other person in charge of the premises for which the tax receipt was issued 2 the cease and desist order shall require the owner or holder of the business tax receipt to cease and desist from further violating or from further violations of the ordinances of the city or from any applicable state or county statute or ordinance applicable to the premises for which such receipt was issued within 30 days from the date of service of the order provided that for good cause shown the director may extend the time for compliance with the order 3 the person or business entity to whom the order to cease and desist has been issued pursuant to this section shall be entitled to appeal the issuance of the order in the manner provided in section 78107 an appeal pursuant to this provision shall act as an automatic stay of the cease and desist order until the appeal has been decided b revocation of suspension of receipt if the person or business entity to whom the cease and desist order has been issued fails to comply with the order within the time set forth in this section the director or the designated official shall be entitled to and shall have the authority to suspend or revoke the business tax receipt of the business for which the order was issued or take such action as may be appropriate to correct the problem for which the cease and desist order was issued upon any revocation or suspension the owner or holder of the receipt shall immediately cease all business operating under the tax receipt if the city is required to seek injunctive relief to enforce the provisions of this section it shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys fees expended in order to enforce the cease and desist order nothing contained in this section shall prevent the city from pursuing any and all legal remedies available to it including but not limited to criminal prosecution of the receipt owner or holder or the manager of the premises for which such receipt was issued and any employees found to be working on the premises at the expiration of the 30 days given for compliance with the order c summary order when the conduct of any receipt holder is so inimical to the public health safety and general welfare as to constitute a nuisance and thus give rise to an emergency the director or the designated official shall have the authority to issue a summary order requiring the cessation of business and the close of premises or suspending or revoking the permit unless waived in writing within 30 days after the issuance of the summary order the director or his designated official shall conduct a special hearing for such action in respect to the summary order as may be therein determined notice of such hearing shall be given the affected person in the manner prescribed in this section d hearing the hearing held in accordance with this section shall be conducted by an independent hearing officer designated by the city manager and not an employee of the city and whose decision shall be binding upon the parties either party may appeal the hearing officers decision pursuant to section 78107 e revocation for violation of article notwithstanding the provisions of subsection a d of this section upon conviction in a court of a violation of any provisions of this article the business tax receipt issued to the party convicted shall be immediately and automatically thereby revoked f revocation for cause notwithstanding the provisions of subsections a e of this section the city commission reserves the right to revoke any business tax receipt for cause  41007 appeals a any person aggrieved by any decision of the director or his designated official made pursuant to this article after hearing shall have the right to appeal to the city commission by filing a written appeal with the city clerks office within ten days following the effective date of the action or decision complained of and by paying the prescribed fee as set by resolution of the city commission in effect at the time of appeal b such appeal shall set out a copy of the order or decision appealed from and shall include a statement of the facts relied upon to reverse such order at the time of filing any such appeal a copy thereof shall be filed by the appellant with director or his designated official c all appeals shall be heard by a hearing officer designated by the city commission no later than 30 days from receipt of the appeal appellant shall be served with a written notice of appeals hearing stating the date place and time of the hearing the notice of appeals hearing shall be personally served upon the receipt holder either to his or her attorney if represented by counsel or shall be made at the address set forth on the tax receipt  and shall be directed to the person named as owner or operator of the business for which the receipt was issued if the owner of the receipt is a corporation partnership or other business entity then service shall be made upon the person holding or owning the tax receipt if the owner or operator of the business cannot be found on the premises of the business then service may be made upon any manager or other person in charge of the premises for which the tax receipt was issued service of the notice of appeals hearing shall be made within five business days of its issuance the city commission shall also give such notice to the director or his designated official and such officer shall be entitled to appear and defend such order or to present his appeal the findings of the city commission shall be final and conclusive and shall be personally served upon the appellant as required in this section  41007 records a person issued a business tax receipt shall keep all records and books necessary to the computation of his business tax and to the enforcement of this article when the receipt holder has failed to keep the books and records required in this article the city manager shall make his own determination as to the financial statement for the business of such receipt holder  41007 general standards of conduct every business tax receipt holder shall 1 permit all reasonable inspections of his business and examinations of his books by public authorities so authorized by law  2 ascertain and at all times comply with all laws and regulations applicable to his business  3 avoid all forbidden improper or unnecessary practices or conditions which do or may affect the public health morals or welfare  and 4 refrain from operating the business for which such receipt was issued on such premises after expiration of the receipt and during the period the receipt and privilege of doing business in the city is revoked or suspended pursuant to this article  41007 tax schedule the occupational license taxes levied by section 7891
